                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not like the Tower, of any place.</div>
                     <div class="line">Did Julius Caesar build that place, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">He did, my gracious lord, begin that place;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, since, succeeding ages have re-edified.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it upon record, or else reported</div>
                     <div class="line">Successively from age to age, he built it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon record, my gracious lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">But say, my lord, it were not register'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks the truth should live from age to age,</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'twere retail'd to all posterity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to the general all-ending day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  So wise so young, they say, do never</div>
                     <div class="line">live long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you, uncle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, without characters, fame lives long.</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">Thus, like the formal vice, Iniquity,</div>
                     <div class="line">I moralize two meanings in one word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">That Julius Caesar was a famous man;</div>
                     <div class="line">With what his valour did enrich his wit,</div>
                     <div class="line">His wit set down to make his valour live</div>
                     <div class="line">Death makes no conquest of this conqueror;</div>
                     <div class="line">For now he lives in fame, though not in life.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell you what, my cousin Buckingham,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What, my gracious lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">An if I live until I be a man,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll win our ancient right in France again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or die a soldier, as I lived a king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Short summers lightly have a forward spring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter young YORK, HASTINGS, and the CARDINAL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, in good time, here comes the Duke of York.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard of York! how fares our loving brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, my dread lord; so must I call you now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, brother, to our grief, as it is yours:</div>
                     <div class="line">Too late he died that might have kept that title,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which by his death hath lost much majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">How fares our cousin, noble Lord of York?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you, gentle uncle. O, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You said that idle weeds are fast in growth</div>
                     <div class="line">The prince my brother hath outgrown me far.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore is he idle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my fair cousin, I must not say so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Then is he more beholding to you than I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He may command me as my sovereign;</div>
                     <div class="line">But you have power in me as in a kinsman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, uncle, give me this dagger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My dagger, little cousin? with all my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">A beggar, brother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my kind uncle, that I know will give;</div>
                     <div class="line">And being but a toy, which is no grief to give.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">A greater gift than that I'll give my cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">A greater gift! O, that's the sword to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentle cousin, were it light enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then, I see, you will part but with light gifts;</div>
                     <div class="line">In weightier things you'll say a beggar nay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">It is too heavy for your grace to wear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I weigh it lightly, were it heavier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">What, would you have my weapon, little lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I would, that I might thank you as you call me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">How?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Little.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord of York will still be cross in talk:</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, your grace knows how to bear with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">You mean, to bear me, not to bear with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, my brother mocks both you and me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Because that I am little, like an ape,</div>
                     <div class="line">He thinks that you should bear me on your shoulders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">With what a sharp-provided wit he reasons!</div>
                     <div class="line">To mitigate the scorn he gives his uncle,</div>
                     <div class="line">He prettily and aptly taunts himself:</div>
                     <div class="line">So cunning and so young is wonderful.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, will't please you pass along?</div>
                     <div class="line">Myself and my good cousin Buckingham</div>
                     <div class="line">Will to your mother, to entreat of her</div>
                     <div class="line">To meet you at the Tower and welcome you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">What, will you go unto the Tower, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord protector needs will have it so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall not sleep in quiet at the Tower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what should you fear?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, my uncle Clarence' angry ghost:</div>
                     <div class="line">My grandam told me he was murdered there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear no uncles dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor none that live, I hope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCE EDWARD</div>
                     <div class="line">An if they live, I hope I need not fear.</div>
                     <div class="line">But come, my lord; and with a heavy heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thinking on them, go I unto the Tower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A Sennet. Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM
and CATESBY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Think you, my lord, this little prating York</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not incensed by his subtle mother</div>
                     <div class="line">To taunt and scorn you thus opprobriously?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">No doubt, no doubt; O, 'tis a parlous boy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bold, quick, ingenious, forward, capable</div>
                     <div class="line">He is all the mother's, from the top to toe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, let them rest. Come hither, Catesby.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art sworn as deeply to effect what we intend</div>
                     <div class="line">As closely to conceal what we impart:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st our reasons urged upon the way;</div>
                     <div class="line">What think'st thou? is it not an easy matter</div>
                     <div class="line">To make William Lord Hastings of our mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">For the instalment of this noble duke</div>
                     <div class="line">In the seat royal of this famous isle?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">He for his father's sake so loves the prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he will not be won to aught against him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What think'st thou, then, of Stanley? what will he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">He will do all in all as Hastings doth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, then, no more but this: go, gentle Catesby,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, as it were far off sound thou Lord Hastings,</div>
                     <div class="line">How doth he stand affected to our purpose;</div>
                     <div class="line">And summon him to-morrow to the Tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sit about the coronation.</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou dost find him tractable to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Encourage him, and show him all our reasons:</div>
                     <div class="line">If he be leaden, icy-cold, unwilling,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou so too; and so break off your talk,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give us notice of his inclination:</div>
                     <div class="line">For we to-morrow hold divided councils,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein thyself shalt highly be employ'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Commend me to Lord William: tell him, Catesby,</div>
                     <div class="line">His ancient knot of dangerous adversaries</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow are let blood at Pomfret-castle;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid my friend, for joy of this good news,</div>
                     <div class="line">Give mistress Shore one gentle kiss the more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Catesby, go, effect this business soundly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">My good lords both, with all the heed I may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we hear from you, Catesby, ere we sleep?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">At Crosby Place, there shall you find us both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit CATESBY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, my lord, what shall we do, if we perceive</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Hastings will not yield to our complots?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Chop off his head, man; somewhat we will do:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, look, when I am king, claim thou of me</div>
                     <div class="line">The earldom of Hereford, and the moveables</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof the king my brother stood possess'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll claim that promise at your grace's hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And look to have it yielded with all willingness.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let us sup betimes, that afterwards</div>
                     <div class="line">We may digest our complots in some form.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  Before Lord Hastings' house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">What, ho! my lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Within</span>  Who knocks at the door?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">A messenger from the Lord Stanley.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HASTINGS</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">What is't o'clock?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the stroke of four.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot thy master sleep these tedious nights?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">So it should seem by that I have to say.</div>
                     <div class="line">First, he commends him to your noble lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">And then?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">And then he sends you word</div>
                     <div class="line">He dreamt to-night the boar had razed his helm:</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, he says there are two councils held;</div>
                     <div class="line">And that may be determined at the one</div>
                     <div class="line">which may make you and him to rue at the other.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore he sends to know your lordship's pleasure,</div>
                     <div class="line">If presently you will take horse with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with all speed post with him toward the north,</div>
                     <div class="line">To shun the danger that his soul divines.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, fellow, go, return unto thy lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bid him not fear the separated councils</div>
                     <div class="line">His honour and myself are at the one,</div>
                     <div class="line">And at the other is my servant Catesby</div>
                     <div class="line">Where nothing can proceed that toucheth us</div>
                     <div class="line">Whereof I shall not have intelligence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him his fears are shallow, wanting instance:</div>
                     <div class="line">And for his dreams, I wonder he is so fond</div>
                     <div class="line">To trust the mockery of unquiet slumbers</div>
                     <div class="line">To fly the boar before the boar pursues,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were to incense the boar to follow us</div>
                     <div class="line">And make pursuit where he did mean no chase.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, bid thy master rise and come to me</div>
                     <div class="line">And we will both together to the Tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where, he shall see, the boar will use us kindly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious lord, I'll tell him what you say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter CATESBY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">Many good morrows to my noble lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, Catesby; you are early stirring</div>
                     <div class="line">What news, what news, in this our tottering state?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">It is a reeling world, indeed, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I believe twill never stand upright</div>
                     <div class="line">Tim Richard wear the garland of the realm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">How! wear the garland! dost thou mean the crown?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my good lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have this crown of mine cut from my shoulders</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere I will see the crown so foul misplaced.</div>
                     <div class="line">But canst thou guess that he doth aim at it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, on my life; and hopes to find forward</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his party for the gain thereof:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereupon he sends you this good news,</div>
                     <div class="line">That this same very day your enemies,</div>
                     <div class="line">The kindred of the queen, must die at Pomfret.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, I am no mourner for that news,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because they have been still mine enemies:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, that I'll give my voice on Richard's side,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bar my master's heirs in true descent,</div>
                     <div class="line">God knows I will not do it, to the death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">God keep your lordship in that gracious mind!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">But I shall laugh at this a twelve-month hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">That they who brought me in my master's hate</div>
                     <div class="line">I live to look upon their tragedy.</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee, Catesby--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">What, my lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere a fortnight make me elder,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll send some packing that yet think not on it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis a vile thing to die, my gracious lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">When men are unprepared and look not for it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">O monstrous, monstrous! and so falls it out</div>
                     <div class="line">With Rivers, Vaughan, Grey: and so 'twill do</div>
                     <div class="line">With some men else, who think themselves as safe</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou and I; who, as thou know'st, are dear</div>
                     <div class="line">To princely Richard and to Buckingham.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">The princes both make high account of you;</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">For they account his head upon the bridge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I know they do; and I have well deserved it.</div>
                     <p>Enter STANLEY</p>
                     <div class="line">Come on, come on; where is your boar-spear, man?</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear you the boar, and go so unprovided?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, good morrow; good morrow, Catesby:</div>
                     <div class="line">You may jest on, but, by the holy rood,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do not like these several councils, I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hold my life as dear as you do yours;</div>
                     <div class="line">And never in my life, I do protest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was it more precious to me than 'tis now:</div>
                     <div class="line">Think you, but that I know our state secure,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would be so triumphant as I am?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">The lords at Pomfret, when they rode from London,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were jocund, and supposed their state was sure,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they indeed had no cause to mistrust;</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet, you see how soon the day o'ercast.</div>
                     <div class="line">This sudden stag of rancour I misdoubt:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray God, I say, I prove a needless coward!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, shall we toward the Tower? the day is spent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, have with you. Wot you what, my lord?</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day the lords you talk of are beheaded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">They, for their truth, might better wear their heads</div>
                     <div class="line">Than some that have accused them wear their hats.</div>
                     <div class="line">But come, my lord, let us away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Pursuivant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go on before; I'll talk with this good fellow.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt STANLEY and CATESBY</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, sirrah! how goes the world with thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pursuivant</div>
                     <div class="line">The better that your lordship please to ask.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee, man, 'tis better with me now</div>
                     <div class="line">Than when I met thee last where now we meet:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then was I going prisoner to the Tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the suggestion of the queen's allies;</div>
                     <div class="line">But now, I tell thee--keep it to thyself--</div>
                     <div class="line">This day those enemies are put to death,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I in better state than e'er I was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pursuivant</div>
                     <div class="line">God hold it, to your honour's good content!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Gramercy, fellow: there, drink that for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Throws him his purse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Pursuivant</div>
                     <div class="line">God save your lordship!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter a Priest</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Priest</div>
                     <div class="line">Well met, my lord; I am glad to see your honour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank thee, good Sir John, with all my heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am in your debt for your last exercise;</div>
                     <div class="line">Come the next Sabbath, and I will content you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He whispers in his ear</p>
               <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What, talking with a priest, lord chamberlain?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your friends at Pomfret, they do need the priest;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your honour hath no shriving work in hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good faith, and when I met this holy man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Those men you talk of came into my mind.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, go you toward the Tower?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, my lord; but long I shall not stay</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall return before your lordship thence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis like enough, for I stay dinner there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  And supper too, although thou know'st it not.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, will you go?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll wait upon your lordship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  Pomfret Castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter RATCLIFF, with halberds, carrying RIVERS,
GREY, and VAUGHAN to death</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, bring forth the prisoners.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Richard Ratcliff, let me tell thee this:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day shalt thou behold a subject die</div>
                     <div class="line">For truth, for duty, and for loyalty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">God keep the prince from all the pack of you!</div>
                     <div class="line">A knot you are of damned blood-suckers!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">VAUGHAN</div>
                     <div class="line">You live that shall cry woe for this after.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Dispatch; the limit of your lives is out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                     <div class="line">O Pomfret, Pomfret! O thou bloody prison,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fatal and ominous to noble peers!</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the guilty closure of thy walls</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard the second here was hack'd to death;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, for more slander to thy dismal seat,</div>
                     <div class="line">We give thee up our guiltless blood to drink.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                     <div class="line">Now Margaret's curse is fall'n upon our heads,</div>
                     <div class="line">For standing by when Richard stabb'd her son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                     <div class="line">Then cursed she Hastings, then cursed she Buckingham,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then cursed she Richard. O, remember, God</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear her prayers for them, as now for us</div>
                     <div class="line">And for my sister and her princely sons,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be satisfied, dear God, with our true blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, as thou know'st, unjustly must be spilt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Make haste; the hour of death is expiate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Grey, come, Vaughan, let us all embrace:</div>
                     <div class="line">And take our leave, until we meet in heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM, DERBY, HASTINGS, the BISHOP OF
ELY, RATCLIFF, LOVEL, with others, and take their
seats at a table</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">My lords, at once: the cause why we are met</div>
                     <div class="line">Is, to determine of the coronation.</div>
                     <div class="line">In God's name, speak: when is the royal day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Are all things fitting for that royal time?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                     <div class="line">It is, and wants but nomination.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, then, I judge a happy day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Who knows the lord protector's mind herein?</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is most inward with the royal duke?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace, we think, should soonest know his mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, I, my lord I we know each other's faces,</div>
                     <div class="line">But for our hearts, he knows no more of mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I of yours;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I no more of his, than you of mine.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Hastings, you and he are near in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank his grace, I know he loves me well;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, for his purpose in the coronation.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have not sounded him, nor he deliver'd</div>
                     <div class="line">His gracious pleasure any way therein:</div>
                     <div class="line">But you, my noble lords, may name the time;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the duke's behalf I'll give my voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, I presume, he'll take in gentle part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GLOUCESTER</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                     <div class="line">Now in good time, here comes the duke himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My noble lords and cousins all, good morrow.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been long a sleeper; but, I hope,</div>
                     <div class="line">My absence doth neglect no great designs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which by my presence might have been concluded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Had not you come upon your cue, my lord</div>
                     <div class="line">William Lord Hastings had pronounced your part,--</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, your voice,--for crowning of the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Than my Lord Hastings no man might be bolder;</div>
                     <div class="line">His lordship knows me well, and loves me well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord of Ely!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was last in Holborn,</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw good strawberries in your garden there</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you send for some of them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, and will, my lord, with all my heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin of Buckingham, a word with you.</div>
                     <p>Drawing him aside</p>
                     <div class="line">Catesby hath sounded Hastings in our business,</div>
                     <div class="line">And finds the testy gentleman so hot,</div>
                     <div class="line">As he will lose his head ere give consent</div>
                     <div class="line">His master's son, as worshipful as he terms it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall lose the royalty of England's throne.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Withdraw you hence, my lord, I'll follow you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM following</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                     <div class="line">We have not yet set down this day of triumph.</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, in mine opinion, is too sudden;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I myself am not so well provided</div>
                     <div class="line">As else I would be, were the day prolong'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BISHOP OF ELY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is my lord protector? I have sent for these</div>
                     <div class="line">strawberries.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">His grace looks cheerfully and smooth to-day;</div>
                     <div class="line">There's some conceit or other likes him well,</div>
                     <div class="line">When he doth bid good morrow with such a spirit.</div>
                     <div class="line">I think there's never a man in Christendom</div>
                     <div class="line">That can less hide his love or hate than he;</div>
                     <div class="line">For by his face straight shall you know his heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                     <div class="line">What of his heart perceive you in his face</div>
                     <div class="line">By any likelihood he show'd to-day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, that with no man here he is offended;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, were he, he had shown it in his looks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray God he be not, I say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you all, tell me what they deserve</div>
                     <div class="line">That do conspire my death with devilish plots</div>
                     <div class="line">Of damned witchcraft, and that have prevail'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my body with their hellish charms?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">The tender love I bear your grace, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes me most forward in this noble presence</div>
                     <div class="line">To doom the offenders, whatsoever they be</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, my lord, they have deserved death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Then be your eyes the witness of this ill:</div>
                     <div class="line">See how I am bewitch'd; behold mine arm</div>
                     <div class="line">Is, like a blasted sapling, wither'd up:</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is Edward's wife, that monstrous witch,</div>
                     <div class="line">Consorted with that harlot strumpet Shore,</div>
                     <div class="line">That by their witchcraft thus have marked me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">If they have done this thing, my gracious lord--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">If I thou protector of this damned strumpet--</div>
                     <div class="line">Tellest thou me of 'ifs'?  Thou art a traitor:</div>
                     <div class="line">Off with his head! Now, by Saint Paul I swear,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not dine until I see the same.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lovel and Ratcliff, look that it be done:</div>
                     <div class="line">The rest, that love me, rise and follow me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but HASTINGS, RATCLIFF, and LOVEL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">Woe, woe for England! not a whit for me;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I, too fond, might have prevented this.</div>
                     <div class="line">Stanley did dream the boar did raze his helm;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I disdain'd it, and did scorn to fly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Three times to-day my foot-cloth horse did stumble,</div>
                     <div class="line">And startled, when he look'd upon the Tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">As loath to bear me to the slaughter-house.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, now I want the priest that spake to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I now repent I told the pursuivant</div>
                     <div class="line">As 'twere triumphing at mine enemies,</div>
                     <div class="line">How they at Pomfret bloodily were butcher'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I myself secure in grace and favour.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Margaret, Margaret, now thy heavy curse</div>
                     <div class="line">Is lighted on poor Hastings' wretched head!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                     <div class="line">Dispatch, my lord; the duke would be at dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">Make a short shrift; he longs to see your head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">O momentary grace of mortal men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we more hunt for than the grace of God!</div>
                     <div class="line">Who builds his hopes in air of your good looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lives like a drunken sailor on a mast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ready, with every nod, to tumble down</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the fatal bowels of the deep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LOVEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, dispatch; 'tis bootless to exclaim.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                     <div class="line">O bloody Richard! miserable England!</div>
                     <div class="line">I prophesy the fearful'st time to thee</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever wretched age hath look'd upon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, lead me to the block; bear him my head.</div>
                     <div class="line">They smile at me that shortly shall be dead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The Tower-walls.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM, in rotten armour,
marvellous ill-favoured</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, cousin, canst thou quake, and change thy colour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder thy breath in the middle of a word,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then begin again, and stop again,</div>
                     <div class="line">As if thou wert distraught and mad with terror?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, I can counterfeit the deep tragedian;</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak and look back, and pry on every side,</div>
                     <div class="line">Tremble and start at wagging of a straw,</div>
                     <div class="line">Intending deep suspicion: ghastly looks</div>
                     <div class="line">Are at my service, like enforced smiles;</div>
                     <div class="line">And both are ready in their offices,</div>
                     <div class="line">At any time, to grace my stratagems.</div>
                     <div class="line">But what, is Catesby gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">He is; and, see, he brings the mayor along.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the Lord Mayor and CATESBY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord mayor,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to the drawbridge there!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark! a drum.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Catesby, o'erlook the walls.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord mayor, the reason we have sent--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Look back, defend thee, here are enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">God and our innocency defend and guard us!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Be patient, they are friends, Ratcliff and Lovel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LOVEL and RATCLIFF, with HASTINGS' head</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LOVEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is the head of that ignoble traitor,</div>
                     <div class="line">The dangerous and unsuspected Hastings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">So dear I loved the man, that I must weep.</div>
                     <div class="line">I took him for the plainest harmless creature</div>
                     <div class="line">That breathed upon this earth a Christian;</div>
                     <div class="line">Made him my book wherein my soul recorded</div>
                     <div class="line">The history of all her secret thoughts:</div>
                     <div class="line">So smooth he daub'd his vice with show of virtue,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, his apparent open guilt omitted,</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, his conversation with Shore's wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">He lived from all attainder of suspect.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well, he was the covert'st shelter'd traitor</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever lived.</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you imagine, or almost believe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were't not that, by great preservation,</div>
                     <div class="line">We live to tell it you, the subtle traitor</div>
                     <div class="line">This day had plotted, in the council-house</div>
                     <div class="line">To murder me and my good Lord of Gloucester?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">What, had he so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">What, think You we are Turks or infidels?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or that we would, against the form of law,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed thus rashly to the villain's death,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that the extreme peril of the case,</div>
                     <div class="line">The peace of England and our persons' safety,</div>
                     <div class="line">Enforced us to this execution?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, fair befall you! he deserved his death;</div>
                     <div class="line">And you my good lords, both have well proceeded,</div>
                     <div class="line">To warn false traitors from the like attempts.</div>
                     <div class="line">I never look'd for better at his hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">After he once fell in with Mistress Shore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet had not we determined he should die,</div>
                     <div class="line">Until your lordship came to see his death;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now the loving haste of these our friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Somewhat against our meaning, have prevented:</div>
                     <div class="line">Because, my lord, we would have had you heard</div>
                     <div class="line">The traitor speak, and timorously confess</div>
                     <div class="line">The manner and the purpose of his treason;</div>
                     <div class="line">That you might well have signified the same</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the citizens, who haply may</div>
                     <div class="line">Misconstrue us in him and wail his death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">But, my good lord, your grace's word shall serve,</div>
                     <div class="line">As well as I had seen and heard him speak</div>
                     <div class="line">And doubt you not, right noble princes both,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I'll acquaint our duteous citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">With all your just proceedings in this cause.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">And to that end we wish'd your lord-ship here,</div>
                     <div class="line">To avoid the carping censures of the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">But since you come too late of our intents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet witness what you hear we did intend:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, my good lord mayor, we bid farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit Lord Mayor</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, after, after, cousin Buckingham.</div>
                     <div class="line">The mayor towards Guildhall hies him in all post:</div>
                     <div class="line">There, at your meet'st advantage of the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Infer the bastardy of Edward's children:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell them how Edward put to death a citizen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Only for saying he would make his son</div>
                     <div class="line">Heir to the crown; meaning indeed his house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, by the sign thereof was termed so.</div>
                     <div class="line">Moreover, urge his hateful luxury</div>
                     <div class="line">And bestial appetite in change of lust;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which stretched to their servants, daughters, wives,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even where his lustful eye or savage heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without control, listed to make his prey.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, for a need, thus far come near my person:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell them, when that my mother went with child</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that unsatiate Edward, noble York</div>
                     <div class="line">My princely father then had wars in France</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by just computation of the time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Found that the issue was not his begot;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which well appeared in his lineaments,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being nothing like the noble duke my father:</div>
                     <div class="line">But touch this sparingly, as 'twere far off,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because you know, my lord, my mother lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Fear not, my lord, I'll play the orator</div>
                     <div class="line">As if the golden fee for which I plead</div>
                     <div class="line">Were for myself: and so, my lord, adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">If you thrive well, bring them to Baynard's Castle;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where you shall find me well accompanied</div>
                     <div class="line">With reverend fathers and well-learned bishops.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I go: and towards three or four o'clock</div>
                     <div class="line">Look for the news that the Guildhall affords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit BUCKINGHAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, Lovel, with all speed to Doctor Shaw;</div>
                     <p>To CATESBY</p>
                     <div class="line">Go thou to Friar Penker; bid them both</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet me within this hour at Baynard's Castle.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER</p>
                     <div class="line">Now will I in, to take some privy order,</div>
                     <div class="line">To draw the brats of Clarence out of sight;</div>
