                     <div class="line">And to give notice, that no manner of person</div>
                     <div class="line">At any time have recourse unto the princes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Scrivener, with a paper in his hand</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Scrivener</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the indictment of the good Lord Hastings;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in a set hand fairly is engross'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">That it may be this day read over in Paul's.</div>
                     <div class="line">And mark how well the sequel hangs together:</div>
                     <div class="line">Eleven hours I spent to write it over,</div>
                     <div class="line">For yesternight by Catesby was it brought me;</div>
                     <div class="line">The precedent was full as long a-doing:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet within these five hours lived Lord Hastings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Untainted, unexamined, free, at liberty</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a good world the while! Why who's so gross,</div>
                     <div class="line">That seeth not this palpable device?</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet who's so blind, but says he sees it not?</div>
                     <div class="line">Bad is the world; and all will come to nought,</div>
                     <div class="line">When such bad dealings must be seen in thought.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Baynard's Castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM, at several doors</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, my lord, what say the citizens?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the holy mother of our Lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The citizens are mum and speak not a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Touch'd you the bastardy of Edward's children?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I did; with his contract with Lady Lucy,</div>
                     <div class="line">And his contract by deputy in France;</div>
                     <div class="line">The insatiate greediness of his desires,</div>
                     <div class="line">And his enforcement of the city wives;</div>
                     <div class="line">His tyranny for trifles; his own bastardy,</div>
                     <div class="line">As being got, your father then in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">His resemblance, being not like the duke;</div>
                     <div class="line">Withal I did infer your lineaments,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being the right idea of your father,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both in your form and nobleness of mind;</div>
                     <div class="line">Laid open all your victories in Scotland,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your dicipline in war, wisdom in peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your bounty, virtue, fair humility:</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, left nothing fitting for the purpose</div>
                     <div class="line">Untouch'd, or slightly handled, in discourse</div>
                     <div class="line">And when mine oratory grew to an end</div>
                     <div class="line">I bid them that did love their country's good</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry 'God save Richard, England's royal king!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah! and did they so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No, so God help me, they spake not a word;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, like dumb statues or breathing stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gazed each on other, and look'd deadly pale.</div>
                     <div class="line">Which when I saw, I reprehended them;</div>
                     <div class="line">And ask'd the mayor what meant this wilful silence:</div>
                     <div class="line">His answer was, the people were not wont</div>
                     <div class="line">To be spoke to but by the recorder.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then he was urged to tell my tale again,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thus saith the duke, thus hath the duke inferr'd;'</div>
                     <div class="line">But nothing spake in warrant from himself.</div>
                     <div class="line">When he had done, some followers of mine own,</div>
                     <div class="line">At the lower end of the hall, hurl'd up their caps,</div>
                     <div class="line">And some ten voices cried 'God save King Richard!'</div>
                     <div class="line">And thus I took the vantage of those few,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thanks, gentle citizens and friends,' quoth I;</div>
                     <div class="line">'This general applause and loving shout</div>
                     <div class="line">Argues your wisdoms and your love to Richard:'</div>
                     <div class="line">And even here brake off, and came away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">What tongueless blocks were they! would not they speak?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by my troth, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not the mayor then and his brethren come?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">The mayor is here at hand: intend some fear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not you spoke with, but by mighty suit:</div>
                     <div class="line">And look you get a prayer-book in your hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stand betwixt two churchmen, good my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">For on that ground I'll build a holy descant:</div>
                     <div class="line">And be not easily won to our request:</div>
                     <div class="line">Play the maid's part, still answer nay, and take it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I go; and if you plead as well for them</div>
                     <div class="line">As I can say nay to thee for myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">No doubt well bring it to a happy issue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, up to the leads; the lord mayor knocks.</div>
                     <p>Exit GLOUCESTER</p>
                     <p>Enter the Lord Mayor and Citizens</p>
                     <div class="line">Welcome my lord; I dance attendance here;</div>
                     <div class="line">I think the duke will not be spoke withal.</div>
                     <p>Enter CATESBY</p>
                     <div class="line">Here comes his servant: how now, Catesby,</div>
                     <div class="line">What says he?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord: he doth entreat your grace;</div>
                     <div class="line">To visit him to-morrow or next day:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is within, with two right reverend fathers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Divinely bent to meditation;</div>
                     <div class="line">And no worldly suit would he be moved,</div>
                     <div class="line">To draw him from his holy exercise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Return, good Catesby, to thy lord again;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him, myself, the mayor and citizens,</div>
                     <div class="line">In deep designs and matters of great moment,</div>
                     <div class="line">No less importing than our general good,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are come to have some conference with his grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll tell him what you say, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, ha, my lord, this prince is not an Edward!</div>
                     <div class="line">He is not lolling on a lewd day-bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">But on his knees at meditation;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not dallying with a brace of courtezans,</div>
                     <div class="line">But meditating with two deep divines;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not sleeping, to engross his idle body,</div>
                     <div class="line">But praying, to enrich his watchful soul:</div>
                     <div class="line">Happy were England, would this gracious prince</div>
                     <div class="line">Take on himself the sovereignty thereof:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, sure, I fear, we shall ne'er win him to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, God forbid his grace should say us nay!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear he will.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter CATESBY</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, Catesby, what says your lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">He wonders to what end you have assembled</div>
                     <div class="line">Such troops of citizens to speak with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">His grace not being warn'd thereof before:</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, he fears you mean no good to him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Sorry I am my noble cousin should</div>
                     <div class="line">Suspect me, that I mean no good to him:</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, I come in perfect love to him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so once more return and tell his grace.</div>
                     <p>Exit CATESBY</p>
                     <div class="line">When holy and devout religious men</div>
                     <div class="line">Are at their beads, 'tis hard to draw them thence,</div>
                     <div class="line">So sweet is zealous contemplation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GLOUCESTER aloft, between two Bishops.
CATESBY returns</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">See, where he stands between two clergymen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Two props of virtue for a Christian prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">To stay him from the fall of vanity:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, see, a book of prayer in his hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">True ornaments to know a holy man.</div>
                     <div class="line">Famous Plantagenet, most gracious prince,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend favourable ears to our request;</div>
                     <div class="line">And pardon us the interruption</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thy devotion and right Christian zeal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, there needs no such apology:</div>
                     <div class="line">I rather do beseech you pardon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, earnest in the service of my God,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neglect the visitation of my friends.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, leaving this, what is your grace's pleasure?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Even that, I hope, which pleaseth God above,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all good men of this ungovern'd isle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I do suspect I have done some offence</div>
                     <div class="line">That seems disgracious in the city's eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that you come to reprehend my ignorance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">You have, my lord: would it might please your grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">At our entreaties, to amend that fault!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Else wherefore breathe I in a Christian land?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Then know, it is your fault that you resign</div>
                     <div class="line">The supreme seat, the throne majestical,</div>
                     <div class="line">The scepter'd office of your ancestors,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your state of fortune and your due of birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">The lineal glory of your royal house,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the corruption of a blemished stock:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst, in the mildness of your sleepy thoughts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which here we waken to our country's good,</div>
                     <div class="line">This noble isle doth want her proper limbs;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her face defaced with scars of infamy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her royal stock graft with ignoble plants,</div>
                     <div class="line">And almost shoulder'd in the swallowing gulf</div>
                     <div class="line">Of blind forgetfulness and dark oblivion.</div>
                     <div class="line">Which to recure, we heartily solicit</div>
                     <div class="line">Your gracious self to take on you the charge</div>
                     <div class="line">And kingly government of this your land,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not as protector, steward, substitute,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or lowly factor for another's gain;</div>
                     <div class="line">But as successively from blood to blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your right of birth, your empery, your own.</div>
                     <div class="line">For this, consorted with the citizens,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your very worshipful and loving friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by their vehement instigation,</div>
                     <div class="line">In this just suit come I to move your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not whether to depart in silence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or bitterly to speak in your reproof.</div>
                     <div class="line">Best fitteth my degree or your condition</div>
                     <div class="line">If not to answer, you might haply think</div>
                     <div class="line">Tongue-tied ambition, not replying, yielded</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear the golden yoke of sovereignty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which fondly you would here impose on me;</div>
                     <div class="line">If to reprove you for this suit of yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">So season'd with your faithful love to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, on the other side, I cheque'd my friends.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, to speak, and to avoid the first,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then, in speaking, not to incur the last,</div>
                     <div class="line">Definitively thus I answer you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your love deserves my thanks; but my desert</div>
                     <div class="line">Unmeritable shuns your high request.</div>
                     <div class="line">First if all obstacles were cut away,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that my path were even to the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">As my ripe revenue and due by birth</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet so much is my poverty of spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">So mighty and so many my defects,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I had rather hide me from my greatness,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being a bark to brook no mighty sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than in my greatness covet to be hid,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the vapour of my glory smother'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, God be thank'd, there's no need of me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And much I need to help you, if need were;</div>
                     <div class="line">The royal tree hath left us royal fruit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, mellow'd by the stealing hours of time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will well become the seat of majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make, no doubt, us happy by his reign.</div>
                     <div class="line">On him I lay what you would lay on me,</div>
                     <div class="line">The right and fortune of his happy stars;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which God defend that I should wring from him!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, this argues conscience in your grace;</div>
                     <div class="line">But the respects thereof are nice and trivial,</div>
                     <div class="line">All circumstances well considered.</div>
                     <div class="line">You say that Edward is your brother's son:</div>
                     <div class="line">So say we too, but not by Edward's wife;</div>
                     <div class="line">For first he was contract to Lady Lucy--</div>
                     <div class="line">Your mother lives a witness to that vow--</div>
                     <div class="line">And afterward by substitute betroth'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To Bona, sister to the King of France.</div>
                     <div class="line">These both put by a poor petitioner,</div>
                     <div class="line">A care-crazed mother of a many children,</div>
                     <div class="line">A beauty-waning and distressed widow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the afternoon of her best days,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made prize and purchase of his lustful eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Seduced the pitch and height of all his thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">To base declension and loathed bigamy</div>
                     <div class="line">By her, in his unlawful bed, he got</div>
                     <div class="line">This Edward, whom our manners term the prince.</div>
                     <div class="line">More bitterly could I expostulate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Save that, for reverence to some alive,</div>
                     <div class="line">I give a sparing limit to my tongue.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, good my lord, take to your royal self</div>
                     <div class="line">This proffer'd benefit of dignity;</div>
                     <div class="line">If non to bless us and the land withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet to draw forth your noble ancestry</div>
                     <div class="line">From the corruption of abusing times,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto a lineal true-derived course.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, good my lord, your citizens entreat you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Refuse not, mighty lord, this proffer'd love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">O, make them joyful, grant their lawful suit!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, why would you heap these cares on me?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am unfit for state and majesty;</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, take it not amiss;</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot nor I will not yield to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">If you refuse it,--as, in love and zeal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Loath to depose the child, Your brother's son;</div>
                     <div class="line">As well we know your tenderness of heart</div>
                     <div class="line">And gentle, kind, effeminate remorse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we have noted in you to your kin,</div>
                     <div class="line">And egally indeed to all estates,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet whether you accept our suit or no,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brother's son shall never reign our king;</div>
                     <div class="line">But we will plant some other in the throne,</div>
                     <div class="line">To the disgrace and downfall of your house:</div>
                     <div class="line">And in this resolution here we leave you.--</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, citizens: 'zounds! I'll entreat no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">O, do not swear, my lord of Buckingham.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit BUCKINGHAM with the Citizens</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">Call them again, my lord, and accept their suit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANOTHER</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, good my lord, lest all the land do rue it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Would you enforce me to a world of care?</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, call them again. I am not made of stone,</div>
                     <div class="line">But penetrable to your. kind entreats,</div>
                     <div class="line">Albeit against my conscience and my soul.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter BUCKINGHAM and the rest</p>
                     <div class="line">Cousin of Buckingham, and you sage, grave men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you will buckle fortune on my back,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear her burthen, whether I will or no,</div>
                     <div class="line">I must have patience to endure the load:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if black scandal or foul-faced reproach</div>
                     <div class="line">Attend the sequel of your imposition,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your mere enforcement shall acquittance me</div>
                     <div class="line">From all the impure blots and stains thereof;</div>
                     <div class="line">For God he knows, and you may partly see,</div>
                     <div class="line">How far I am from the desire thereof.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless your grace! we see it, and will say it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">In saying so, you shall but say the truth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I salute you with this kingly title:</div>
                     <div class="line">Long live Richard, England's royal king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                     <div class="speaker">Citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow will it please you to be crown'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Even when you please, since you will have it so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow, then, we will attend your grace:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so most joyfully we take our leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, let us to our holy task again.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, good cousin; farewell, gentle friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  Before the Tower.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  London. The palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.5">4. SCENE IV.  Before the palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.6">5. SCENE V.  Lord Derby's house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Before the Tower.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter, on one side, QUEEN ELIZABETH, DUCHESS OF
YORK, and DORSET; on the other, ANNE, Duchess of
Gloucester, leading Lady Margaret Plantagenet,
CLARENCE's young Daughter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">Who meets us here?  my niece Plantagenet</div>
                     <div class="line">Led in the hand of her kind aunt of Gloucester?</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, for my life, she's wandering to the Tower,</div>
                     <div class="line">On pure heart's love to greet the tender princes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Daughter, well met.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">God give your graces both</div>
                     <div class="line">A happy and a joyful time of day!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">As much to you, good sister! Whither away?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">No farther than the Tower; and, as I guess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the like devotion as yourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">To gratulate the gentle princes there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Kind sister, thanks: we'll enter all together.</div>
                     <p>Enter BRAKENBURY</p>
                     <div class="line">And, in good time, here the lieutenant comes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Master lieutenant, pray you, by your leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">How doth the prince, and my young son of York?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Right well, dear madam. By your patience,</div>
                     <div class="line">I may not suffer you to visit them;</div>
                     <div class="line">The king hath straitly charged the contrary.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">The king! why, who's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">I cry you mercy: I mean the lord protector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lord protect him from that kingly title!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he set bounds betwixt their love and me?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am their mother; who should keep me from them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">I am their fathers mother; I will see them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Their aunt I am in law, in love their mother:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then bring me to their sights; I'll bear thy blame</div>
                     <div class="line">And take thy office from thee, on my peril.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">No, madam, no; I may not leave it so:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am bound by oath, and therefore pardon me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Enter LORD STANLEY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me but meet you, ladies, one hour hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll salute your grace of York as mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">And reverend looker on, of two fair queens.</div>
                     <p>To LADY ANNE</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, madam, you must straight to Westminster,</div>
                     <div class="line">There to be crowned Richard's royal queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, cut my lace in sunder, that my pent heart</div>
                     <div class="line">May have some scope to beat, or else I swoon</div>
                     <div class="line">With this dead-killing news!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Despiteful tidings! O unpleasing news!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                     <div class="line">Be of good cheer: mother, how fares your grace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">O Dorset, speak not to me, get thee hence!</div>
                     <div class="line">Death and destruction dog thee at the heels;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mother's name is ominous to children.</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou wilt outstrip death, go cross the seas,</div>
                     <div class="line">And live with Richmond, from the reach of hell</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, hie thee, hie thee from this slaughter-house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest thou increase the number of the dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">And make me die the thrall of Margaret's curse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor mother, wife, nor England's counted queen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of wise care is this your counsel, madam.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take all the swift advantage of the hours;</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall have letters from me to my son</div>
                     <div class="line">To meet you on the way, and welcome you.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be not ta'en tardy by unwise delay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">O ill-dispersing wind of misery!</div>
                     <div class="line">O my accursed womb, the bed of death!</div>
                     <div class="line">A cockatrice hast thou hatch'd to the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose unavoided eye is murderous.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORD STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, madam, come; I in all haste was sent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">And I in all unwillingness will go.</div>
                     <div class="line">I would to God that the inclusive verge</div>
                     <div class="line">Of golden metal that must round my brow</div>
                     <div class="line">Were red-hot steel, to sear me to the brain!</div>
                     <div class="line">Anointed let me be with deadly venom,</div>
                     <div class="line">And die, ere men can say, God save the queen!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, go, poor soul, I envy not thy glory</div>
                     <div class="line">To feed my humour, wish thyself no harm.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">No! why?  When he that is my husband now</div>
                     <div class="line">Came to me, as I follow'd Henry's corse,</div>
                     <div class="line">When scarce the blood was well wash'd from his hands</div>
                     <div class="line">Which issued from my other angel husband</div>
                     <div class="line">And that dead saint which then I weeping follow'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">O, when, I say, I look'd on Richard's face,</div>
                     <div class="line">This was my wish: 'Be thou,' quoth I, ' accursed,</div>
                     <div class="line">For making me, so young, so old a widow!</div>
                     <div class="line">And, when thou wed'st, let sorrow haunt thy bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">And be thy wife--if any be so mad--</div>
                     <div class="line">As miserable by the life of thee</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou hast made me by my dear lord's death!</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, ere I can repeat this curse again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in so short a space, my woman's heart</div>
                     <div class="line">Grossly grew captive to his honey words</div>
                     <div class="line">And proved the subject of my own soul's curse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which ever since hath kept my eyes from rest;</div>
                     <div class="line">For never yet one hour in his bed</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I enjoy'd the golden dew of sleep,</div>
                     <div class="line">But have been waked by his timorous dreams.</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, he hates me for my father Warwick;</div>
                     <div class="line">And will, no doubt, shortly be rid of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Poor heart, adieu! I pity thy complaining.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">No more than from my soul I mourn for yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, thou woful welcomer of glory!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu, poor soul, that takest thy leave of it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To DORSET</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">Go thou to Richmond, and good fortune guide thee!</div>
                     <p>To LADY ANNE</p>
                     <div class="line">Go thou to Richard, and good angels guard thee!</div>
                     <p>To QUEEN ELIZABETH</p>
                     <div class="line">Go thou to sanctuary, and good thoughts possess thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">I to my grave, where peace and rest lie with me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Eighty odd years of sorrow have I seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">And each hour's joy wrecked with a week of teen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, yet look back with me unto the Tower.</div>
                     <div class="line">Pity, you ancient stones, those tender babes</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom envy hath immured within your walls!</div>
                     <div class="line">Rough cradle for such little pretty ones!</div>
                     <div class="line">Rude ragged nurse, old sullen playfellow</div>
                     <div class="line">For tender princes, use my babies well!</div>
                     <div class="line">So foolish sorrow bids your stones farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  London. The palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Sennet. Enter KING RICHARD III, in pomp, crowned;
BUCKINGHAM, CATESBY, a page, and others</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand all apart Cousin of Buckingham!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious sovereign?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy hand.</div>
                     <p>Here he ascendeth his throne</p>
                     <div class="line">Thus high, by thy advice</div>
                     <div class="line">And thy assistance, is King Richard seated;</div>
                     <div class="line">But shall we wear these honours for a day?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or shall they last, and we rejoice in them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Still live they and for ever may they last!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">O Buckingham, now do I play the touch,</div>
                     <div class="line">To try if thou be current gold indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Edward lives: think now what I would say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Say on, my loving lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Buckingham, I say, I would be king,</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, so you are, my thrice renowned liege.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha! am I king? 'tis so: but Edward lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">True, noble prince.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">O bitter consequence,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Edward still should live! 'True, noble prince!'</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, thou wert not wont to be so dull:</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I be plain? I wish the bastards dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I would have it suddenly perform'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">What sayest thou? speak suddenly; be brief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Your grace may do your pleasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, tut, thou art all ice, thy kindness freezeth:</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, have I thy consent that they shall die?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me some breath, some little pause, my lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I positively herein:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will resolve your grace immediately.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to a stander by</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">The king is angry: see, he bites the lip.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">I will converse with iron-witted fools</div>
                     <div class="line">And unrespective boys: none are for me</div>
                     <div class="line">That look into me with considerate eyes:</div>
                     <div class="line">High-reaching Buckingham grows circumspect.</div>
                     <div class="line">Boy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Know'st thou not any whom corrupting gold</div>
                     <div class="line">Would tempt unto a close exploit of death?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I know a discontented gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose humble means match not his haughty mind:</div>
                     <div class="line">Gold were as good as twenty orators,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will, no doubt, tempt him to any thing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">What is his name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Page</div>
                     <div class="line">His name, my lord, is Tyrrel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">I partly know the man: go, call him hither.</div>
                     <p>Exit Page</p>
                     <div class="line">The deep-revolving witty Buckingham</div>
                     <div class="line">No more shall be the neighbour to my counsel:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath he so long held out with me untired,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stops he now for breath?</div>
                     <p>Enter STANLEY</p>
                     <div class="line">How now! what news with you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STANLEY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I hear the Marquis Dorset's fled</div>
                     <div class="line">To Richmond, in those parts beyond the sea</div>
                     <div class="line">Where he abides.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Stands apart</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Catesby!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Rumour it abroad</div>
                     <div class="line">That Anne, my wife, is sick and like to die:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will take order for her keeping close.</div>
                     <div class="line">Inquire me out some mean-born gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I will marry straight to Clarence' daughter:</div>
                     <div class="line">The boy is foolish, and I fear not him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, how thou dream'st! I say again, give out</div>
                     <div class="line">That Anne my wife is sick and like to die:</div>
                     <div class="line">About it; for it stands me much upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">To stop all hopes whose growth may damage me.</div>
                     <p>Exit CATESBY</p>
                     <div class="line">I must be married to my brother's daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else my kingdom stands on brittle glass.</div>
                     <div class="line">Murder her brothers, and then marry her!</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncertain way of gain! But I am in</div>
                     <div class="line">So far in blood that sin will pluck on sin:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tear-falling pity dwells not in this eye.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter Page, with TYRREL</p>
                     <div class="line">Is thy name Tyrrel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">James Tyrrel, and your most obedient subject.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Art thou, indeed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">Prove me, my gracious sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Darest thou resolve to kill a friend of mine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I had rather kill two enemies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, there thou hast it: two deep enemies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Foes to my rest and my sweet sleep's disturbers</div>
                     <div class="line">Are they that I would have thee deal upon:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tyrrel, I mean those bastards in the Tower.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me have open means to come to them,</div>
                     <div class="line">And soon I'll rid you from the fear of them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou sing'st sweet music. Hark, come hither, Tyrrel</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, by this token: rise, and lend thine ear:</div>
                     <p>Whispers</p>
                     <div class="line">There is no more but so: say it is done,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will love thee, and prefer thee too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis done, my gracious lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we hear from thee, Tyrrel, ere we sleep?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ye shall, my Lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <p>Re-enter BUCKINGHAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord, I have consider'd in my mind</div>
                     <div class="line">The late demand that you did sound me in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, let that pass. Dorset is fled to Richmond.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear that news, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Stanley, he is your wife's son well, look to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I claim your gift, my due by promise,</div>
                     <div class="line">For which your honour and your faith is pawn'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">The earldom of Hereford and the moveables</div>
                     <div class="line">The which you promised I should possess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Stanley, look to your wife; if she convey</div>
                     <div class="line">Letters to Richmond, you shall answer it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">What says your highness to my just demand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">As I remember, Henry the Sixth</div>
                     <div class="line">Did prophesy that Richmond should be king,</div>
                     <div class="line">When Richmond was a little peevish boy.</div>
                     <div class="line">A king, perhaps, perhaps,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">How chance the prophet could not at that time</div>
                     <div class="line">Have told me, I being by, that I should kill him?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, your promise for the earldom,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Richmond! When last I was at Exeter,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mayor in courtesy show'd me the castle,</div>
                     <div class="line">And call'd it Rougemont: at which name I started,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because a bard of Ireland told me once</div>
                     <div class="line">I should not live long after I saw Richmond.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, what's o'clock?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thus bold to put your grace in mind</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what you promised me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, but what's o'clock?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the stroke of ten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, let it strike.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why let it strike?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Because that, like a Jack, thou keep'st the stroke</div>
                     <div class="line">Betwixt thy begging and my meditation.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not in the giving vein to-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then resolve me whether you will or no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Tut, tut,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou troublest me; am not in the vein.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but BUCKINGHAM</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it even so? rewards he my true service</div>
                     <div class="line">With such deep contempt made I him king for this?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, let me think on Hastings, and be gone</div>
                     <div class="line">To Brecknock, while my fearful head is on!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter TYRREL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">The tyrannous and bloody deed is done.</div>
                     <div class="line">The most arch of piteous massacre</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever yet this land was guilty of.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dighton and Forrest, whom I did suborn</div>
                     <div class="line">To do this ruthless piece of butchery,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although they were flesh'd villains, bloody dogs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Melting with tenderness and kind compassion</div>
                     <div class="line">Wept like two children in their deaths' sad stories.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Lo, thus' quoth Dighton, 'lay those tender babes:'</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thus, thus,' quoth Forrest, 'girdling one another</div>
                     <div class="line">Within their innocent alabaster arms:</div>
                     <div class="line">Their lips were four red roses on a stalk,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in their summer beauty kiss'd each other.</div>
                     <div class="line">A book of prayers on their pillow lay;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which once,' quoth Forrest, 'almost changed my mind;</div>
                     <div class="line">But O! the devil'--there the villain stopp'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst Dighton thus told on: 'We smothered</div>
                     <div class="line">The most replenished sweet work of nature,</div>
                     <div class="line">That from the prime creation e'er she framed.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus both are gone with conscience and remorse;</div>
                     <div class="line">They could not speak; and so I left them both,</div>
                     <div class="line">To bring this tidings to the bloody king.</div>
                     <div class="line">And here he comes.</div>
                     <p>Enter KING RICHARD III</p>
                     <div class="line">All hail, my sovereign liege!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Kind Tyrrel, am I happy in thy news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">If to have done the thing you gave in charge</div>
                     <div class="line">Beget your happiness, be happy then,</div>
                     <div class="line">For it is done, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">But didst thou see them dead?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">I did, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">And buried, gentle Tyrrel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">TYRREL</div>
                     <div class="line">The chaplain of the Tower hath buried them;</div>
                     <div class="line">But how or in what place I do not know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Come to me, Tyrrel, soon at after supper,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt tell the process of their death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime, but think how I may do thee good,</div>
                     <div class="line">And be inheritor of thy desire.</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell till soon.</div>
                     <p>Exit TYRREL</p>
                     <div class="line">The son of Clarence have I pent up close;</div>
                     <div class="line">His daughter meanly have I match'd in marriage;</div>
                     <div class="line">The sons of Edward sleep in Abraham's bosom,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Anne my wife hath bid the world good night.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, for I know the Breton Richmond aims</div>
                     <div class="line">At young Elizabeth, my brother's daughter,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by that knot, looks proudly o'er the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">To her I go, a jolly thriving wooer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CATESBY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Good news or bad, that thou comest in so bluntly?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                     <div class="line">Bad news, my lord: Ely is fled to Richmond;</div>
                     <div class="line">And Buckingham, back'd with the hardy Welshmen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is in the field, and still his power increaseth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                     <div class="line">Ely with Richmond troubles me more near</div>
