                     <span class="personname">DUCHESS of YORK, Mother to King Edward IV.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LADY ANNE, Widow of Edward Prince of Wales, son to King Henry VI; afterwards married to Richard.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A young Daughter of Clarence [MARGARET PLANTAGENET] </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Ghosts of those murdered by Richard III., Lords and other Attendants; a Pursuivant Scrivener, Citizens, Murderers, Messengers Soldiers, &c.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  England.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  London. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. Another street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. The Tower.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, solus</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Now is the winter of our discontent</div>
                              <div class="line">Made glorious summer by this sun of York;</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house</div>
                              <div class="line">In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now are our brows bound with victorious wreaths;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our bruised arms hung up for monuments;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our stern alarums changed to merry meetings,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our dreadful marches to delightful measures.</div>
                              <div class="line">Grim-visaged war hath smooth'd his wrinkled front;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now, instead of mounting barded steeds</div>
                              <div class="line">To fright the souls of fearful adversaries,</div>
                              <div class="line">He capers nimbly in a lady's chamber</div>
                              <div class="line">To the lascivious pleasing of a lute.</div>
                              <div class="line">But I, that am not shaped for sportive tricks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor made to court an amorous looking-glass;</div>
                              <div class="line">I, that am rudely stamp'd, and want love's majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">To strut before a wanton ambling nymph;</div>
                              <div class="line">I, that am curtail'd of this fair proportion,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cheated of feature by dissembling nature,</div>
                              <div class="line">Deformed, unfinish'd, sent before my time</div>
                              <div class="line">Into this breathing world, scarce half made up,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that so lamely and unfashionable</div>
                              <div class="line">That dogs bark at me as I halt by them;</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, I, in this weak piping time of peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have no delight to pass away the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless to spy my shadow in the sun</div>
                              <div class="line">And descant on mine own deformity:</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore, since I cannot prove a lover,</div>
                              <div class="line">To entertain these fair well-spoken days,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am determined to prove a villain</div>
                              <div class="line">And hate the idle pleasures of these days.</div>
                              <div class="line">Plots have I laid, inductions dangerous,</div>
                              <div class="line">By drunken prophecies, libels and dreams,</div>
                              <div class="line">To set my brother Clarence and the king</div>
                              <div class="line">In deadly hate the one against the other:</div>
                              <div class="line">And if King Edward be as true and just</div>
                              <div class="line">As I am subtle, false and treacherous,</div>
                              <div class="line">This day should Clarence closely be mew'd up,</div>
                              <div class="line">About a prophecy, which says that 'G'</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Edward's heirs the murderer shall be.</div>
                              <div class="line">Dive, thoughts, down to my soul: here</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence comes.</div>
                              <p>Enter CLARENCE, guarded, and BRAKENBURY</p>
                              <div class="line">Brother, good day; what means this armed guard</div>
                              <div class="line">That waits upon your grace?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">His majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Tendering my person's safety, hath appointed</div>
                              <div class="line">This conduct to convey me to the Tower.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon what cause?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Because my name is George.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack, my lord, that fault is none of yours;</div>
                              <div class="line">He should, for that, commit your godfathers:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, belike his majesty hath some intent</div>
                              <div class="line">That you shall be new-christen'd in the Tower.</div>
                              <div class="line">But what's the matter, Clarence?  may I know?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, Richard, when I know; for I protest</div>
                              <div class="line">As yet I do not: but, as I can learn,</div>
                              <div class="line">He hearkens after prophecies and dreams;</div>
                              <div class="line">And from the cross-row plucks the letter G.</div>
                              <div class="line">And says a wizard told him that by G</div>
                              <div class="line">His issue disinherited should be;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, for my name of George begins with G,</div>
                              <div class="line">It follows in his thought that I am he.</div>
                              <div class="line">These, as I learn, and such like toys as these</div>
                              <div class="line">Have moved his highness to commit me now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, this it is, when men are ruled by women:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not the king that sends you to the Tower:</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lady Grey his wife, Clarence, 'tis she</div>
                              <div class="line">That tempers him to this extremity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Was it not she and that good man of worship,</div>
                              <div class="line">Anthony Woodville, her brother there,</div>
                              <div class="line">That made him send Lord Hastings to the Tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">From whence this present day he is deliver'd?</div>
                              <div class="line">We are not safe, Clarence; we are not safe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I think there's no man is secure</div>
                              <div class="line">But the queen's kindred and night-walking heralds</div>
                              <div class="line">That trudge betwixt the king and Mistress Shore.</div>
                              <div class="line">Heard ye not what an humble suppliant</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord hastings was to her for his delivery?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Humbly complaining to her deity</div>
                              <div class="line">Got my lord chamberlain his liberty.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell you what; I think it is our way,</div>
                              <div class="line">If we will keep in favour with the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be her men and wear her livery:</div>
                              <div class="line">The jealous o'erworn widow and herself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since that our brother dubb'd them gentlewomen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Are mighty gossips in this monarchy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I beseech your graces both to pardon me;</div>
                              <div class="line">His majesty hath straitly given in charge</div>
                              <div class="line">That no man shall have private conference,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of what degree soever, with his brother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so; an't please your worship, Brakenbury,</div>
                              <div class="line">You may partake of any thing we say:</div>
                              <div class="line">We speak no treason, man: we say the king</div>
                              <div class="line">Is wise and virtuous, and his noble queen</div>
                              <div class="line">Well struck in years, fair, and not jealous;</div>
                              <div class="line">We say that Shore's wife hath a pretty foot,</div>
                              <div class="line">A cherry lip, a bonny eye, a passing pleasing tongue;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that the queen's kindred are made gentle-folks:</div>
                              <div class="line">How say you sir? Can you deny all this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">With this, my lord, myself have nought to do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Naught to do with mistress Shore! I tell thee, fellow,</div>
                              <div class="line">He that doth naught with her, excepting one,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were best he do it secretly, alone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">What one, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Her husband, knave: wouldst thou betray me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I beseech your grace to pardon me, and withal</div>
                              <div class="line">Forbear your conference with the noble duke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">We know thy charge, Brakenbury, and will obey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">We are the queen's abjects, and must obey.</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, farewell: I will unto the king;</div>
                              <div class="line">And whatsoever you will employ me in,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were it to call King Edward's widow sister,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will perform it to enfranchise you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Meantime, this deep disgrace in brotherhood</div>
                              <div class="line">Touches me deeper than you can imagine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I know it pleaseth neither of us well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, your imprisonment shall not be long;</div>
                              <div class="line">Meantime, have patience.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I must perforce. Farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt CLARENCE, BRAKENBURY, and Guard</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, tread the path that thou shalt ne'er return.</div>
                              <div class="line">Simple, plain Clarence! I do love thee so,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I will shortly send thy soul to heaven,</div>
                              <div class="line">If heaven will take the present at our hands.</div>
                              <div class="line">But who comes here? the new-deliver'd Hastings?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter HASTINGS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good time of day unto my gracious lord!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">As much unto my good lord chamberlain!</div>
                              <div class="line">Well are you welcome to the open air.</div>
                              <div class="line">How hath your lordship brook'd imprisonment?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">With patience, noble lord, as prisoners must:</div>
                              <div class="line">But I shall live, my lord, to give them thanks</div>
                              <div class="line">That were the cause of my imprisonment.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">No doubt, no doubt; and so shall Clarence too;</div>
                              <div class="line">For they that were your enemies are his,</div>
                              <div class="line">And have prevail'd as much on him as you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">More pity that the eagle should be mew'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">While kites and buzzards prey at liberty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What news abroad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">No news so bad abroad as this at home;</div>
                              <div class="line">The King is sickly, weak and melancholy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And his physicians fear him mightily.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by Saint Paul, this news is bad indeed.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he hath kept an evil diet long,</div>
                              <div class="line">And overmuch consumed his royal person:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis very grievous to be thought upon.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, is he in his bed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">He is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Go you before, and I will follow you.</div>
                              <p>Exit HASTINGS</p>
                              <div class="line">He cannot live, I hope; and must not die</div>
                              <div class="line">Till George be pack'd with post-horse up to heaven.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll in, to urge his hatred more to Clarence,</div>
                              <div class="line">With lies well steel'd with weighty arguments;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, if I fall not in my deep intent,</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence hath not another day to live:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which done, God take King Edward to his mercy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave the world for me to bustle in!</div>
                              <div class="line">For then I'll marry Warwick's youngest daughter.</div>
                              <div class="line">What though I kill'd her husband and her father?</div>
                              <div class="line">The readiest way to make the wench amends</div>
                              <div class="line">Is to become her husband and her father:</div>
                              <div class="line">The which will I; not all so much for love</div>
                              <div class="line">As for another secret close intent,</div>
                              <div class="line">By marrying her which I must reach unto.</div>
                              <div class="line">But yet I run before my horse to market:</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence still breathes; Edward still lives and reigns:</div>
                              <div class="line">When they are gone, then must I count my gains.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. Another street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter the corpse of KING HENRY the Sixth, Gentlemen
with halberds to guard it; LADY ANNE being the mourner</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Set down, set down your honourable load,</div>
                              <div class="line">If honour may be shrouded in a hearse,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst I awhile obsequiously lament</div>
                              <div class="line">The untimely fall of virtuous Lancaster.</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor key-cold figure of a holy king!</div>
                              <div class="line">Pale ashes of the house of Lancaster!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou bloodless remnant of that royal blood!</div>
                              <div class="line">Be it lawful that I invocate thy ghost,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear the lamentations of Poor Anne,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wife to thy Edward, to thy slaughter'd son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stabb'd by the selfsame hand that made these wounds!</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, in these windows that let forth thy life,</div>
                              <div class="line">I pour the helpless balm of my poor eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">Cursed be the hand that made these fatal holes!</div>
                              <div class="line">Cursed be the heart that had the heart to do it!</div>
                              <div class="line">Cursed the blood that let this blood from hence!</div>
                              <div class="line">More direful hap betide that hated wretch,</div>
                              <div class="line">That makes us wretched by the death of thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than I can wish to adders, spiders, toads,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or any creeping venom'd thing that lives!</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever he have child, abortive be it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Prodigious, and untimely brought to light,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose ugly and unnatural aspect</div>
                              <div class="line">May fright the hopeful mother at the view;</div>
                              <div class="line">And that be heir to his unhappiness!</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever he have wife, let her he made</div>
                              <div class="line">A miserable by the death of him</div>
                              <div class="line">As I am made by my poor lord and thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, now towards Chertsey with your holy load,</div>
                              <div class="line">Taken from Paul's to be interred there;</div>
                              <div class="line">And still, as you are weary of the weight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rest you, whiles I lament King Henry's corse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay, you that bear the corse, and set it down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">What black magician conjures up this fiend,</div>
                              <div class="line">To stop devoted charitable deeds?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Villains, set down the corse; or, by Saint Paul,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll make a corse of him that disobeys.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, stand back, and let the coffin pass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Unmanner'd dog! stand thou, when I command:</div>
                              <div class="line">Advance thy halbert higher than my breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, by Saint Paul, I'll strike thee to my foot,</div>
                              <div class="line">And spurn upon thee, beggar, for thy boldness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">What, do you tremble? are you all afraid?</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, I blame you not; for you are mortal,</div>
                              <div class="line">And mortal eyes cannot endure the devil.</div>
                              <div class="line">Avaunt, thou dreadful minister of hell!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou hadst but power over his mortal body,</div>
                              <div class="line">His soul thou canst not have; therefore be gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet saint, for charity, be not so curst.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul devil, for God's sake, hence, and trouble us not;</div>
                              <div class="line">For thou hast made the happy earth thy hell,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fill'd it with cursing cries and deep exclaims.</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou delight to view thy heinous deeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold this pattern of thy butcheries.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, gentlemen, see, see! dead Henry's wounds</div>
                              <div class="line">Open their congeal'd mouths and bleed afresh!</div>
                              <div class="line">Blush, Blush, thou lump of foul deformity;</div>
                              <div class="line">For 'tis thy presence that exhales this blood</div>
                              <div class="line">From cold and empty veins, where no blood dwells;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy deed, inhuman and unnatural,</div>
                              <div class="line">Provokes this deluge most unnatural.</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, which this blood madest, revenge his death!</div>
                              <div class="line">O earth, which this blood drink'st revenge his death!</div>
                              <div class="line">Either heaven with lightning strike the</div>
                              <div class="line">murderer dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or earth, gape open wide and eat him quick,</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou dost swallow up this good king's blood</div>
                              <div class="line">Which his hell-govern'd arm hath butchered!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Lady, you know no rules of charity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which renders good for bad, blessings for curses.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Villain, thou know'st no law of God nor man:</div>
                              <div class="line">No beast so fierce but knows some touch of pity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">But I know none, and therefore am no beast.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">O wonderful, when devils tell the truth!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">More wonderful, when angels are so angry.</div>
                              <div class="line">Vouchsafe, divine perfection of a woman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of these supposed-evils, to give me leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">By circumstance, but to acquit myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Vouchsafe, defused infection of a man,</div>
                              <div class="line">For these known evils, but to give me leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">By circumstance, to curse thy cursed self.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Fairer than tongue can name thee, let me have</div>
                              <div class="line">Some patient leisure to excuse myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Fouler than heart can think thee, thou canst make</div>
                              <div class="line">No excuse current, but to hang thyself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">By such despair, I should accuse myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by despairing, shouldst thou stand excused;</div>
                              <div class="line">For doing worthy vengeance on thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which didst unworthy slaughter upon others.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Say that I slew them not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then they are not dead:</div>
                              <div class="line">But dead they are, and devilish slave, by thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I did not kill your husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then he is alive.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, he is dead; and slain by Edward's hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">In thy foul throat thou liest: Queen Margaret saw</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy murderous falchion smoking in his blood;</div>
                              <div class="line">The which thou once didst bend against her breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that thy brothers beat aside the point.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I was provoked by her slanderous tongue,</div>
                              <div class="line">which laid their guilt upon my guiltless shoulders.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wast provoked by thy bloody mind.</div>
                              <div class="line">Which never dreamt on aught but butcheries:</div>
                              <div class="line">Didst thou not kill this king?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I grant ye.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Dost grant me, hedgehog? then, God grant me too</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou mayst be damned for that wicked deed!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he was gentle, mild, and virtuous!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The fitter for the King of heaven, that hath him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">He is in heaven, where thou shalt never come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him thank me, that holp to send him thither;</div>
                              <div class="line">For he was fitter for that place than earth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou unfit for any place but hell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, one place else, if you will hear me name it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Some dungeon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Your bed-chamber.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll rest betide the chamber where thou liest!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">So will it, madam till I lie with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I know so. But, gentle Lady Anne,</div>
                              <div class="line">To leave this keen encounter of our wits,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fall somewhat into a slower method,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not the causer of the timeless deaths</div>
                              <div class="line">Of these Plantagenets, Henry and Edward,</div>
                              <div class="line">As blameful as the executioner?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art the cause, and most accursed effect.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Your beauty was the cause of that effect;</div>
                              <div class="line">Your beauty: which did haunt me in my sleep</div>
                              <div class="line">To undertake the death of all the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">So I might live one hour in your sweet bosom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">If I thought that, I tell thee, homicide,</div>
                              <div class="line">These nails should rend that beauty from my cheeks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">These eyes could never endure sweet beauty's wreck;</div>
                              <div class="line">You should not blemish it, if I stood by:</div>
                              <div class="line">As all the world is cheered by the sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">So I by that; it is my day, my life.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Black night o'ershade thy day, and death thy life!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Curse not thyself, fair creature thou art both.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I would I were, to be revenged on thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">It is a quarrel most unnatural,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be revenged on him that loveth you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">It is a quarrel just and reasonable,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be revenged on him that slew my husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He that bereft thee, lady, of thy husband,</div>
                              <div class="line">Did it to help thee to a better husband.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">His better doth not breathe upon the earth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He lives that loves thee better than he could.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Name him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Plantagenet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that was he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The selfsame name, but one of better nature.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Here.</div>
                              <p>She spitteth at him</p>
                              <div class="line">Why dost thou spit at me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Would it were mortal poison, for thy sake!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Never came poison from so sweet a place.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Never hung poison on a fouler toad.</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of my sight! thou dost infect my eyes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Thine eyes, sweet lady, have infected mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Would they were basilisks, to strike thee dead!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I would they were, that I might die at once;</div>
                              <div class="line">For now they kill me with a living death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Those eyes of thine from mine have drawn salt tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shamed their aspect with store of childish drops:</div>
                              <div class="line">These eyes that never shed remorseful tear,</div>
                              <div class="line">No, when my father York and Edward wept,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear the piteous moan that Rutland made</div>
                              <div class="line">When black-faced Clifford shook his sword at him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor when thy warlike father, like a child,</div>
                              <div class="line">Told the sad story of my father's death,</div>
                              <div class="line">And twenty times made pause to sob and weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">That all the standers-by had wet their cheeks</div>
                              <div class="line">Like trees bedash'd with rain: in that sad time</div>
                              <div class="line">My manly eyes did scorn an humble tear;</div>
                              <div class="line">And what these sorrows could not thence exhale,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy beauty hath, and made them blind with weeping.</div>
                              <div class="line">I never sued to friend nor enemy;</div>
                              <div class="line">My tongue could never learn sweet smoothing word;</div>
                              <div class="line">But now thy beauty is proposed my fee,</div>
                              <div class="line">My proud heart sues, and prompts my tongue to speak.</div>
                              <p>She looks scornfully at him</p>
                              <div class="line">Teach not thy lips such scorn, for they were made</div>
                              <div class="line">For kissing, lady, not for such contempt.</div>
                              <div class="line">If thy revengeful heart cannot forgive,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, here I lend thee this sharp-pointed sword;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which if thou please to hide in this true bosom.</div>
                              <div class="line">And let the soul forth that adoreth thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">I lay it naked to the deadly stroke,</div>
                              <div class="line">And humbly beg the death upon my knee.</div>
                              <p>He lays his breast open: she offers at it with his sword</p>
                              <div class="line">Nay, do not pause; for I did kill King Henry,</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'twas thy beauty that provoked me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, now dispatch; 'twas I that stabb'd young Edward,</div>
                              <div class="line">But 'twas thy heavenly face that set me on.</div>
                              <p>Here she lets fall the sword</p>
                              <div class="line">Take up the sword again, or take up me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Arise, dissembler: though I wish thy death,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not be the executioner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Then bid me kill myself, and I will do it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I have already.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush, that was in thy rage:</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak it again, and, even with the word,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hand, which, for thy love, did kill thy love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall, for thy love, kill a far truer love;</div>
                              <div class="line">To both their deaths thou shalt be accessary.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I would I knew thy heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis figured in my tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear me both are false.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Then never man was true.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, well, put up your sword.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, then, my peace is made.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">That shall you know hereafter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">But shall I live in hope?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">All men, I hope, live so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Vouchsafe to wear this ring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">To take is not to give.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, how this ring encompasseth finger.</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so thy breast encloseth my poor heart;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wear both of them, for both of them are thine.</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thy poor devoted suppliant may</div>
                              <div class="line">But beg one favour at thy gracious hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou dost confirm his happiness for ever.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">What is it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">That it would please thee leave these sad designs</div>
                              <div class="line">To him that hath more cause to be a mourner,</div>
                              <div class="line">And presently repair to Crosby Place;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where, after I have solemnly interr'd</div>
                              <div class="line">At Chertsey monastery this noble king,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wet his grave with my repentant tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will with all expedient duty see you:</div>
                              <div class="line">For divers unknown reasons. I beseech you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Grant me this boon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">With all my heart; and much it joys me too,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see you are become so penitent.</div>
                              <div class="line">Tressel and Berkeley, go along with me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid me farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis more than you deserve;</div>
                              <div class="line">But since you teach me how to flatter you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Imagine I have said farewell already.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt LADY ANNE, TRESSEL, and BERKELEY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirs, take up the corse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GENTLEMEN</div>
                              <div class="line">Towards Chertsey, noble lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">No, to White-Friars; there attend my coining.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER</p>
                              <div class="line">Was ever woman in this humour woo'd?</div>
                              <div class="line">Was ever woman in this humour won?</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have her; but I will not keep her long.</div>
                              <div class="line">What! I, that kill'd her husband and his father,</div>
                              <div class="line">To take her in her heart's extremest hate,</div>
                              <div class="line">With curses in her mouth, tears in her eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">The bleeding witness of her hatred by;</div>
                              <div class="line">Having God, her conscience, and these bars</div>
                              <div class="line">against me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I nothing to back my suit at all,</div>
                              <div class="line">But the plain devil and dissembling looks,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet to win her, all the world to nothing!</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha!</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath she forgot already that brave prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward, her lord, whom I, some three months since,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stabb'd in my angry mood at Tewksbury?</div>
                              <div class="line">A sweeter and a lovelier gentleman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Framed in the prodigality of nature,</div>
                              <div class="line">Young, valiant, wise, and, no doubt, right royal,</div>
                              <div class="line">The spacious world cannot again afford</div>
                              <div class="line">And will she yet debase her eyes on me,</div>
                              <div class="line">That cropp'd the golden prime of this sweet prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">And made her widow to a woful bed?</div>
                              <div class="line">On me, whose all not equals Edward's moiety?</div>
                              <div class="line">On me, that halt and am unshapen thus?</div>
                              <div class="line">My dukedom to a beggarly denier,</div>
                              <div class="line">I do mistake my person all this while:</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my life, she finds, although I cannot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself to be a marvellous proper man.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll be at charges for a looking-glass,</div>
                              <div class="line">And entertain some score or two of tailors,</div>
                              <div class="line">To study fashions to adorn my body:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I am crept in favour with myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will maintain it with some little cost.</div>
                              <div class="line">But first I'll turn yon fellow in his grave;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then return lamenting to my love.</div>
                              <div class="line">Shine out, fair sun, till I have bought a glass,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I may see my shadow as I pass.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH, RIVERS, and GREY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Have patience, madam: there's no doubt his majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Will soon recover his accustom'd health.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                              <div class="line">In that you brook it in, it makes him worse:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, for God's sake, entertain good comfort,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cheer his grace with quick and merry words.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">If he were dead, what would betide of me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">No other harm but loss of such a lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">The loss of such a lord includes all harm.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                              <div class="line">The heavens have bless'd you with a goodly son,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be your comforter when he is gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh, he is young and his minority</div>
                              <div class="line">Is put unto the trust of Richard Gloucester,</div>
                              <div class="line">A man that loves not me, nor none of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it concluded that he shall be protector?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">It is determined, not concluded yet:</div>
                              <div class="line">But so it must be, if the king miscarry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM and DERBY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Here come the lords of Buckingham and Derby.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Good time of day unto your royal grace!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">God make your majesty joyful as you have been!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">The Countess Richmond, good my Lord of Derby.</div>
                              <div class="line">To your good prayers will scarcely say amen.</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, Derby, notwithstanding she's your wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">And loves not me, be you, good lord, assured</div>
                              <div class="line">I hate not you for her proud arrogance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you, either not believe</div>
                              <div class="line">The envious slanders of her false accusers;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, if she be accused in true report,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bear with her weakness, which, I think proceeds</div>
                              <div class="line">From wayward sickness, and no grounded malice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Saw you the king to-day, my Lord of Derby?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
