                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">But now the Duke of Buckingham and I</div>
                              <div class="line">Are come from visiting his majesty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">What likelihood of his amendment, lords?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, good hope; his grace speaks cheerfully.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">God grant him health! Did you confer with him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, we did: he desires to make atonement</div>
                              <div class="line">Betwixt the Duke of Gloucester and your brothers,</div>
                              <div class="line">And betwixt them and my lord chamberlain;</div>
                              <div class="line">And sent to warn them to his royal presence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Would all were well! but that will never be</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear our happiness is at the highest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, HASTINGS, and DORSET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">They do me wrong, and I will not endure it:</div>
                              <div class="line">Who are they that complain unto the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I, forsooth, am stern, and love them not?</div>
                              <div class="line">By holy Paul, they love his grace but lightly</div>
                              <div class="line">That fill his ears with such dissentious rumours.</div>
                              <div class="line">Because I cannot flatter and speak fair,</div>
                              <div class="line">Smile in men's faces, smooth, deceive and cog,</div>
                              <div class="line">Duck with French nods and apish courtesy,</div>
                              <div class="line">I must be held a rancorous enemy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot a plain man live and think no harm,</div>
                              <div class="line">But thus his simple truth must be abused</div>
                              <div class="line">By silken, sly, insinuating Jacks?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom in all this presence speaks your grace?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">To thee, that hast nor honesty nor grace.</div>
                              <div class="line">When have I injured thee? when done thee wrong?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or thee? or thee? or any of your faction?</div>
                              <div class="line">A plague upon you all! His royal person,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom God preserve better than you would wish!--</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot be quiet scarce a breathing-while,</div>
                              <div class="line">But you must trouble him with lewd complaints.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother of Gloucester, you mistake the matter.</div>
                              <div class="line">The king, of his own royal disposition,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not provoked by any suitor else;</div>
                              <div class="line">Aiming, belike, at your interior hatred,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which in your outward actions shows itself</div>
                              <div class="line">Against my kindred, brothers, and myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes him to send; that thereby he may gather</div>
                              <div class="line">The ground of your ill-will, and so remove it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot tell: the world is grown so bad,</div>
                              <div class="line">That wrens make prey where eagles dare not perch:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since every Jack became a gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">There's many a gentle person made a Jack.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, we know your meaning, brother</div>
                              <div class="line">Gloucester;</div>
                              <div class="line">You envy my advancement and my friends':</div>
                              <div class="line">God grant we never may have need of you!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Meantime, God grants that we have need of you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your brother is imprison'd by your means,</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself disgraced, and the nobility</div>
                              <div class="line">Held in contempt; whilst many fair promotions</div>
                              <div class="line">Are daily given to ennoble those</div>
                              <div class="line">That scarce, some two days since, were worth a noble.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">By Him that raised me to this careful height</div>
                              <div class="line">From that contented hap which I enjoy'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">I never did incense his majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the Duke of Clarence, but have been</div>
                              <div class="line">An earnest advocate to plead for him.</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, you do me shameful injury,</div>
                              <div class="line">Falsely to draw me in these vile suspects.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">You may deny that you were not the cause</div>
                              <div class="line">Of my Lord Hastings' late imprisonment.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">She may, my lord, for--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">She may, Lord Rivers! why, who knows not so?</div>
                              <div class="line">She may do more, sir, than denying that:</div>
                              <div class="line">She may help you to many fair preferments,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then deny her aiding hand therein,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lay those honours on your high deserts.</div>
                              <div class="line">What may she not? She may, yea, marry, may she--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">What, marry, may she?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What, marry, may she! marry with a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">A bachelor, a handsome stripling too:</div>
                              <div class="line">I wis your grandam had a worser match.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Gloucester, I have too long borne</div>
                              <div class="line">Your blunt upbraidings and your bitter scoffs:</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I will acquaint his majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">With those gross taunts I often have endured.</div>
                              <div class="line">I had rather be a country servant-maid</div>
                              <div class="line">Than a great queen, with this condition,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be thus taunted, scorn'd, and baited at:</div>
                              <p>Enter QUEEN MARGARET, behind</p>
                              <div class="line">Small joy have I in being England's queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And lessen'd be that small, God, I beseech thee!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy honour, state and seat is due to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What! threat you me with telling of the king?</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him, and spare not: look, what I have said</div>
                              <div class="line">I will avouch in presence of the king:</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare adventure to be sent to the Tower.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis time to speak; my pains are quite forgot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, devil! I remember them too well:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou slewest my husband Henry in the Tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">And Edward, my poor son, at Tewksbury.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere you were queen, yea, or your husband king,</div>
                              <div class="line">I was a pack-horse in his great affairs;</div>
                              <div class="line">A weeder-out of his proud adversaries,</div>
                              <div class="line">A liberal rewarder of his friends:</div>
                              <div class="line">To royalize his blood I spilt mine own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, and much better blood than his or thine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">In all which time you and your husband Grey</div>
                              <div class="line">Were factious for the house of Lancaster;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, Rivers, so were you. Was not your husband</div>
                              <div class="line">In Margaret's battle at Saint Alban's slain?</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me put in your minds, if you forget,</div>
                              <div class="line">What you have been ere now, and what you are;</div>
                              <div class="line">Withal, what I have been, and what I am.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">A murderous villain, and so still thou art.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor Clarence did forsake his father, Warwick;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, and forswore himself,--which Jesu pardon!--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Which God revenge!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">To fight on Edward's party for the crown;</div>
                              <div class="line">And for his meed, poor lord, he is mew'd up.</div>
                              <div class="line">I would to God my heart were flint, like Edward's;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or Edward's soft and pitiful, like mine</div>
                              <div class="line">I am too childish-foolish for this world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Hie thee to hell for shame, and leave the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou cacodemon! there thy kingdom is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Gloucester, in those busy days</div>
                              <div class="line">Which here you urge to prove us enemies,</div>
                              <div class="line">We follow'd then our lord, our lawful king:</div>
                              <div class="line">So should we you, if you should be our king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">If I should be! I had rather be a pedlar:</div>
                              <div class="line">Far be it from my heart, the thought of it!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">As little joy, my lord, as you suppose</div>
                              <div class="line">You should enjoy, were you this country's king,</div>
                              <div class="line">As little joy may you suppose in me.</div>
                              <div class="line">That I enjoy, being the queen thereof.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">A little joy enjoys the queen thereof;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I am she, and altogether joyless.</div>
                              <div class="line">I can no longer hold me patient.</div>
                              <p>Advancing</p>
                              <div class="line">Hear me, you wrangling pirates, that fall out</div>
                              <div class="line">In sharing that which you have pill'd from me!</div>
                              <div class="line">Which of you trembles not that looks on me?</div>
                              <div class="line">If not, that, I being queen, you bow like subjects,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet that, by you deposed, you quake like rebels?</div>
                              <div class="line">O gentle villain, do not turn away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul wrinkled witch, what makest thou in my sight?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">But repetition of what thou hast marr'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">That will I make before I let thee go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Wert thou not banished on pain of death?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I was; but I do find more pain in banishment</div>
                              <div class="line">Than death can yield me here by my abode.</div>
                              <div class="line">A husband and a son thou owest to me;</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou a kingdom; all of you allegiance:</div>
                              <div class="line">The sorrow that I have, by right is yours,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the pleasures you usurp are mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">The curse my noble father laid on thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou didst crown his warlike brows with paper</div>
                              <div class="line">And with thy scorns drew'st rivers from his eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then, to dry them, gavest the duke a clout</div>
                              <div class="line">Steep'd in the faultless blood of pretty Rutland--</div>
                              <div class="line">His curses, then from bitterness of soul</div>
                              <div class="line">Denounced against thee, are all fall'n upon thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">And God, not we, hath plagued thy bloody deed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">So just is God, to right the innocent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">O, 'twas the foulest deed to slay that babe,</div>
                              <div class="line">And the most merciless that e'er was heard of!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Tyrants themselves wept when it was reported.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">No man but prophesied revenge for it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Northumberland, then present, wept to see it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">What were you snarling all before I came,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready to catch each other by the throat,</div>
                              <div class="line">And turn you all your hatred now on me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Did York's dread curse prevail so much with heaven?</div>
                              <div class="line">That Henry's death, my lovely Edward's death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their kingdom's loss, my woful banishment,</div>
                              <div class="line">Could all but answer for that peevish brat?</div>
                              <div class="line">Can curses pierce the clouds and enter heaven?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then, give way, dull clouds, to my quick curses!</div>
                              <div class="line">If not by war, by surfeit die your king,</div>
                              <div class="line">As ours by murder, to make him a king!</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward thy son, which now is Prince of Wales,</div>
                              <div class="line">For Edward my son, which was Prince of Wales,</div>
                              <div class="line">Die in his youth by like untimely violence!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thyself a queen, for me that was a queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Outlive thy glory, like my wretched self!</div>
                              <div class="line">Long mayst thou live to wail thy children's loss;</div>
                              <div class="line">And see another, as I see thee now,</div>
                              <div class="line">Deck'd in thy rights, as thou art stall'd in mine!</div>
                              <div class="line">Long die thy happy days before thy death;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, after many lengthen'd hours of grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">Die neither mother, wife, nor England's queen!</div>
                              <div class="line">Rivers and Dorset, you were standers by,</div>
                              <div class="line">And so wast thou, Lord Hastings, when my son</div>
                              <div class="line">Was stabb'd with bloody daggers: God, I pray him,</div>
                              <div class="line">That none of you may live your natural age,</div>
                              <div class="line">But by some unlook'd accident cut off!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Have done thy charm, thou hateful wither'd hag!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave out thee? stay, dog, for thou shalt hear me.</div>
                              <div class="line">If heaven have any grievous plague in store</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceeding those that I can wish upon thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let them keep it till thy sins be ripe,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then hurl down their indignation</div>
                              <div class="line">On thee, the troubler of the poor world's peace!</div>
                              <div class="line">The worm of conscience still begnaw thy soul!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy friends suspect for traitors while thou livest,</div>
                              <div class="line">And take deep traitors for thy dearest friends!</div>
                              <div class="line">No sleep close up that deadly eye of thine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless it be whilst some tormenting dream</div>
                              <div class="line">Affrights thee with a hell of ugly devils!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou elvish-mark'd, abortive, rooting hog!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou that wast seal'd in thy nativity</div>
                              <div class="line">The slave of nature and the son of hell!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou slander of thy mother's heavy womb!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou loathed issue of thy father's loins!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou rag of honour! thou detested--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Margaret.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I call thee not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I cry thee mercy then, for I had thought</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou hadst call'd me all these bitter names.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so I did; but look'd for no reply.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let me make the period to my curse!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis done by me, and ends in 'Margaret.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus have you breathed your curse against yourself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor painted queen, vain flourish of my fortune!</div>
                              <div class="line">Why strew'st thou sugar on that bottled spider,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose deadly web ensnareth thee about?</div>
                              <div class="line">Fool, fool! thou whet'st a knife to kill thyself.</div>
                              <div class="line">The time will come when thou shalt wish for me</div>
                              <div class="line">To help thee curse that poisonous bunchback'd toad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">False-boding woman, end thy frantic curse,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest to thy harm thou move our patience.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Foul shame upon you! you have all moved mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Were you well served, you would be taught your duty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">To serve me well, you all should do me duty,</div>
                              <div class="line">Teach me to be your queen, and you my subjects:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, serve me well, and teach yourselves that duty!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispute not with her; she is lunatic.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, master marquess, you are malapert:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your fire-new stamp of honour is scarce current.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, that your young nobility could judge</div>
                              <div class="line">What 'twere to lose it, and be miserable!</div>
                              <div class="line">They that stand high have many blasts to shake them;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if they fall, they dash themselves to pieces.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Good counsel, marry: learn it, learn it, marquess.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">It toucheth you, my lord, as much as me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, and much more: but I was born so high,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our aery buildeth in the cedar's top,</div>
                              <div class="line">And dallies with the wind and scorns the sun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">And turns the sun to shade; alas! alas!</div>
                              <div class="line">Witness my son, now in the shade of death;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose bright out-shining beams thy cloudy wrath</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath in eternal darkness folded up.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your aery buildeth in our aery's nest.</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, that seest it, do not suffer it!</div>
                              <div class="line">As it was won with blood, lost be it so!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Have done! for shame, if not for charity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">Urge neither charity nor shame to me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Uncharitably with me have you dealt,</div>
                              <div class="line">And shamefully by you my hopes are butcher'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">My charity is outrage, life my shame</div>
                              <div class="line">And in that shame still live my sorrow's rage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Have done, have done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">O princely Buckingham I'll kiss thy hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">In sign of league and amity with thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now fair befal thee and thy noble house!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy garments are not spotted with our blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor thou within the compass of my curse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor no one here; for curses never pass</div>
                              <div class="line">The lips of those that breathe them in the air.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll not believe but they ascend the sky,</div>
                              <div class="line">And there awake God's gentle-sleeping peace.</div>
                              <div class="line">O Buckingham, take heed of yonder dog!</div>
                              <div class="line">Look, when he fawns, he bites; and when he bites,</div>
                              <div class="line">His venom tooth will rankle to the death:</div>
                              <div class="line">Have not to do with him, beware of him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Sin, death, and hell have set their marks on him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all their ministers attend on him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What doth she say, my Lord of Buckingham?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing that I respect, my gracious lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN MARGARET</div>
                              <div class="line">What, dost thou scorn me for my gentle counsel?</div>
                              <div class="line">And soothe the devil that I warn thee from?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, but remember this another day,</div>
                              <div class="line">When he shall split thy very heart with sorrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">And say poor Margaret was a prophetess!</div>
                              <div class="line">Live each of you the subjects to his hate,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he to yours, and all of you to God's!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">My hair doth stand on end to hear her curses.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">And so doth mine: I muse why she's at liberty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot blame her: by God's holy mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">She hath had too much wrong; and I repent</div>
                              <div class="line">My part thereof that I have done to her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">I never did her any, to my knowledge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">But you have all the vantage of her wrong.</div>
                              <div class="line">I was too hot to do somebody good,</div>
                              <div class="line">That is too cold in thinking of it now.</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, as for Clarence, he is well repaid,</div>
                              <div class="line">He is frank'd up to fatting for his pains</div>
                              <div class="line">God pardon them that are the cause of it!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">A virtuous and a Christian-like conclusion,</div>
                              <div class="line">To pray for them that have done scathe to us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">So do I ever:</div>
                              <p>Aside</p>
                              <div class="line">being well-advised.</div>
                              <div class="line">For had I cursed now, I had cursed myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CATESBY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, his majesty doth call for you,</div>
                              <div class="line">And for your grace; and you, my noble lords.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Catesby, we come. Lords, will you go with us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, we will attend your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I do the wrong, and first begin to brawl.</div>
                              <div class="line">The secret mischiefs that I set abroach</div>
                              <div class="line">I lay unto the grievous charge of others.</div>
                              <div class="line">Clarence, whom I, indeed, have laid in darkness,</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beweep to many simple gulls</div>
                              <div class="line">Namely, to Hastings, Derby, Buckingham;</div>
                              <div class="line">And say it is the queen and her allies</div>
                              <div class="line">That stir the king against the duke my brother.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, they believe it; and withal whet me</div>
                              <div class="line">To be revenged on Rivers, Vaughan, Grey:</div>
                              <div class="line">But then I sigh; and, with a piece of scripture,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell them that God bids us do good for evil:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus I clothe my naked villany</div>
                              <div class="line">With old odd ends stolen out of holy writ;</div>
                              <div class="line">And seem a saint, when most I play the devil.</div>
                              <p>Enter two Murderers</p>
                              <div class="line">But, soft! here come my executioners.</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, my hardy, stout resolved mates!</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you now going to dispatch this deed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">We are, my lord; and come to have the warrant</div>
                              <div class="line">That we may be admitted where he is.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Well thought upon; I have it here about me.</div>
                              <p>Gives the warrant</p>
                              <div class="line">When you have done, repair to Crosby Place.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, sirs, be sudden in the execution,</div>
                              <div class="line">Withal obdurate, do not hear him plead;</div>
                              <div class="line">For Clarence is well-spoken, and perhaps</div>
                              <div class="line">May move your hearts to pity if you mark him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Tush!</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear not, my lord, we will not stand to prate;</div>
                              <div class="line">Talkers are no good doers: be assured</div>
                              <div class="line">We come to use our hands and not our tongues.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Your eyes drop millstones, when fools' eyes drop tears:</div>
                              <div class="line">I like you, lads; about your business straight;</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, go, dispatch.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">We will, my noble lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  London. The Tower.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter CLARENCE and BRAKENBURY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Why looks your grace so heavily today?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">O, I have pass'd a miserable night,</div>
                              <div class="line">So full of ugly sights, of ghastly dreams,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, as I am a Christian faithful man,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not spend another such a night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though 'twere to buy a world of happy days,</div>
                              <div class="line">So full of dismal terror was the time!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">What was your dream? I long to hear you tell it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Methoughts that I had broken from the Tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">And was embark'd to cross to Burgundy;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in my company, my brother Gloucester;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who from my cabin tempted me to walk</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the hatches: thence we looked toward England,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cited up a thousand fearful times,</div>
                              <div class="line">During the wars of York and Lancaster</div>
                              <div class="line">That had befall'n us. As we paced along</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the giddy footing of the hatches,</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought that Gloucester stumbled; and, in falling,</div>
                              <div class="line">Struck me, that thought to stay him, overboard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the tumbling billows of the main.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord, Lord! methought, what pain it was to drown!</div>
                              <div class="line">What dreadful noise of waters in mine ears!</div>
                              <div class="line">What ugly sights of death within mine eyes!</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought I saw a thousand fearful wrecks;</div>
                              <div class="line">Ten thousand men that fishes gnaw'd upon;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wedges of gold, great anchors, heaps of pearl,</div>
                              <div class="line">Inestimable stones, unvalued jewels,</div>
                              <div class="line">All scatter'd in the bottom of the sea:</div>
                              <div class="line">Some lay in dead men's skulls; and, in those holes</div>
                              <div class="line">Where eyes did once inhabit, there were crept,</div>
                              <div class="line">As 'twere in scorn of eyes, reflecting gems,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which woo'd the slimy bottom of the deep,</div>
                              <div class="line">And mock'd the dead bones that lay scatter'd by.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Had you such leisure in the time of death</div>
                              <div class="line">To gaze upon the secrets of the deep?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought I had; and often did I strive</div>
                              <div class="line">To yield the ghost: but still the envious flood</div>
                              <div class="line">Kept in my soul, and would not let it forth</div>
                              <div class="line">To seek the empty, vast and wandering air;</div>
                              <div class="line">But smother'd it within my panting bulk,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which almost burst to belch it in the sea.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Awaked you not with this sore agony?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">O, no, my dream was lengthen'd after life;</div>
                              <div class="line">O, then began the tempest to my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who pass'd, methought, the melancholy flood,</div>
                              <div class="line">With that grim ferryman which poets write of,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the kingdom of perpetual night.</div>
                              <div class="line">The first that there did greet my stranger soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was my great father-in-law, renowned Warwick;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who cried aloud, 'What scourge for perjury</div>
                              <div class="line">Can this dark monarchy afford false Clarence?'</div>
                              <div class="line">And so he vanish'd: then came wandering by</div>
                              <div class="line">A shadow like an angel, with bright hair</div>
                              <div class="line">Dabbled in blood; and he squeak'd out aloud,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Clarence is come; false, fleeting, perjured Clarence,</div>
                              <div class="line">That stabb'd me in the field by Tewksbury;</div>
                              <div class="line">Seize on him, Furies, take him to your torments!'</div>
                              <div class="line">With that, methoughts, a legion of foul fiends</div>
                              <div class="line">Environ'd me about, and howled in mine ears</div>
                              <div class="line">Such hideous cries, that with the very noise</div>
                              <div class="line">I trembling waked, and for a season after</div>
                              <div class="line">Could not believe but that I was in hell,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such terrible impression made the dream.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">No marvel, my lord, though it affrighted you;</div>
                              <div class="line">I promise, I am afraid to hear you tell it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">O Brakenbury, I have done those things,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which now bear evidence against my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">For Edward's sake; and see how he requites me!</div>
                              <div class="line">O God! if my deep prayers cannot appease thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou wilt be avenged on my misdeeds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet execute thy wrath in me alone,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, spare my guiltless wife and my poor children!</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, gentle keeper, stay by me;</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul is heavy, and I fain would sleep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I will, my lord: God give your grace good rest!</div>
                              <p>CLARENCE sleeps</p>
                              <div class="line">Sorrow breaks seasons and reposing hours,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes the night morning, and the noon-tide night.</div>
                              <div class="line">Princes have but their tides for their glories,</div>
                              <div class="line">An outward honour for an inward toil;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, for unfelt imagination,</div>
                              <div class="line">They often feel a world of restless cares:</div>
                              <div class="line">So that, betwixt their tides and low names,</div>
                              <div class="line">There's nothing differs but the outward fame.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the two Murderers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Ho! who's here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">In God's name what are you, and how came you hither?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">I would speak with Clarence, and I came hither on my legs.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, are you so brief?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">O sir, it is better to be brief than tedious. Show</div>
                              <div class="line">him our commission; talk no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>BRAKENBURY reads it</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BRAKENBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I am, in this, commanded to deliver</div>
                              <div class="line">The noble Duke of Clarence to your hands:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not reason what is meant hereby,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because I will be guiltless of the meaning.</div>
                              <div class="line">Here are the keys, there sits the duke asleep:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll to the king; and signify to him</div>
                              <div class="line">That thus I have resign'd my charge to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Do so, it is a point of wisdom: fare you well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit BRAKENBURY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">What, shall we stab him as he sleeps?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">No; then he will say 'twas done cowardly, when he wakes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">When he wakes! why, fool, he shall never wake till</div>
                              <div class="line">the judgment-day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then he will say we stabbed him sleeping.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">The urging of that word 'judgment' hath bred a kind</div>
                              <div class="line">of remorse in me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">What, art thou afraid?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to kill him, having a warrant for it; but to be</div>
                              <div class="line">damned for killing him, from which no warrant can defend us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">I thought thou hadst been resolute.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">So I am, to let him live.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Back to the Duke of Gloucester, tell him so.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, stay a while: I hope my holy humour</div>
                              <div class="line">will change; 'twas wont to hold me but while one</div>
                              <div class="line">would tell twenty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">How dost thou feel thyself now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">'Faith, some certain dregs of conscience are yet</div>
                              <div class="line">within me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember our reward, when the deed is done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">'Zounds, he dies: I had forgot the reward.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is thy conscience now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">In the Duke of Gloucester's purse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">So when he opens his purse to give us our reward,</div>
                              <div class="line">thy conscience flies out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it go; there's few or none will entertain it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">How if it come to thee again?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll not meddle with it: it is a dangerous thing: it</div>
                              <div class="line">makes a man a coward: a man cannot steal, but it</div>
                              <div class="line">accuseth him; he cannot swear, but it cheques him;</div>
                              <div class="line">he cannot lie with his neighbour's wife, but it</div>
                              <div class="line">detects him: 'tis a blushing shamefast spirit that</div>
                              <div class="line">mutinies in a man's bosom; it fills one full of</div>
                              <div class="line">obstacles: it made me once restore a purse of gold</div>
                              <div class="line">that I found; it beggars any man that keeps it: it</div>
                              <div class="line">is turned out of all towns and cities for a</div>
                              <div class="line">dangerous thing; and every man that means to live</div>
                              <div class="line">well endeavours to trust to himself and to live</div>
                              <div class="line">without it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">'Zounds, it is even now at my elbow, persuading me</div>
                              <div class="line">not to kill the duke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Take the devil in thy mind, and relieve him not: he</div>
                              <div class="line">would insinuate with thee but to make thee sigh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, I am strong-framed, he cannot prevail with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Spoke like a tail fellow that respects his</div>
                              <div class="line">reputation. Come, shall we to this gear?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Take him over the costard with the hilts of thy</div>
                              <div class="line">sword, and then we will chop him in the malmsey-butt</div>
                              <div class="line">in the next room.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">O excellent devise! make a sop of him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark! he stirs: shall I strike?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">No, first let's reason with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Where art thou, keeper? give me a cup of wine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
