                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall have wine enough, my lord, anon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">In God's name, what art thou?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">A man, as you are.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">But not, as I am, royal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor you, as we are, loyal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy voice is thunder, but thy looks are humble.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">My voice is now the king's, my looks mine own.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">How darkly and how deadly dost thou speak!</div>
                              <div class="line">Your eyes do menace me: why look you pale?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who sent you hither? Wherefore do you come?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                              <div class="line">To, to, to--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">To murder me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, ay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">You scarcely have the hearts to tell me so,</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore cannot have the hearts to do it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein, my friends, have I offended you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Offended us you have not, but the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall be reconciled to him again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Never, my lord; therefore prepare to die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Are you call'd forth from out a world of men</div>
                              <div class="line">To slay the innocent? What is my offence?</div>
                              <div class="line">Where are the evidence that do accuse me?</div>
                              <div class="line">What lawful quest have given their verdict up</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the frowning judge? or who pronounced</div>
                              <div class="line">The bitter sentence of poor Clarence' death?</div>
                              <div class="line">Before I be convict by course of law,</div>
                              <div class="line">To threaten me with death is most unlawful.</div>
                              <div class="line">I charge you, as you hope to have redemption</div>
                              <div class="line">By Christ's dear blood shed for our grievous sins,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you depart and lay no hands on me</div>
                              <div class="line">The deed you undertake is damnable.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">What we will do, we do upon command.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">And he that hath commanded is the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Erroneous vassal! the great King of kings</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath in the tables of his law commanded</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou shalt do no murder: and wilt thou, then,</div>
                              <div class="line">Spurn at his edict and fulfil a man's?</div>
                              <div class="line">Take heed; for he holds vengeance in his hands,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hurl upon their heads that break his law.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">And that same vengeance doth he hurl on thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">For false forswearing and for murder too:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou didst receive the holy sacrament,</div>
                              <div class="line">To fight in quarrel of the house of Lancaster.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a traitor to the name of God,</div>
                              <div class="line">Didst break that vow; and with thy treacherous blade</div>
                              <div class="line">Unrip'dst the bowels of thy sovereign's son.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom thou wert sworn to cherish and defend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">How canst thou urge God's dreadful law to us,</div>
                              <div class="line">When thou hast broke it in so dear degree?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas! for whose sake did I that ill deed?</div>
                              <div class="line">For Edward, for my brother, for his sake: Why, sirs,</div>
                              <div class="line">He sends ye not to murder me for this</div>
                              <div class="line">For in this sin he is as deep as I.</div>
                              <div class="line">If God will be revenged for this deed.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, know you yet, he doth it publicly,</div>
                              <div class="line">Take not the quarrel from his powerful arm;</div>
                              <div class="line">He needs no indirect nor lawless course</div>
                              <div class="line">To cut off those that have offended him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Who made thee, then, a bloody minister,</div>
                              <div class="line">When gallant-springing brave Plantagenet,</div>
                              <div class="line">That princely novice, was struck dead by thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">My brother's love, the devil, and my rage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy brother's love, our duty, and thy fault,</div>
                              <div class="line">Provoke us hither now to slaughter thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh, if you love my brother, hate not me;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am his brother, and I love him well.</div>
                              <div class="line">If you be hired for meed, go back again,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will send you to my brother Gloucester,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who shall reward you better for my life</div>
                              <div class="line">Than Edward will for tidings of my death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">You are deceived, your brother Gloucester hates you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">O, no, he loves me, and he holds me dear:</div>
                              <div class="line">Go you to him from me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Both</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, so we will.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him, when that our princely father York</div>
                              <div class="line">Bless'd his three sons with his victorious arm,</div>
                              <div class="line">And charged us from his soul to love each other,</div>
                              <div class="line">He little thought of this divided friendship:</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid Gloucester think of this, and he will weep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, millstones; as be lesson'd us to weep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">O, do not slander him, for he is kind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Right,</div>
                              <div class="line">As snow in harvest. Thou deceivest thyself:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis he that sent us hither now to slaughter thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">It cannot be; for when I parted with him,</div>
                              <div class="line">He hugg'd me in his arms, and swore, with sobs,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he would labour my delivery.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so he doth, now he delivers thee</div>
                              <div class="line">From this world's thraldom to the joys of heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Make peace with God, for you must die, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Hast thou that holy feeling in thy soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">To counsel me to make my peace with God,</div>
                              <div class="line">And art thou yet to thy own soul so blind,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou wilt war with God by murdering me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, sirs, consider, he that set you on</div>
                              <div class="line">To do this deed will hate you for the deed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">What shall we do?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Relent, and save your souls.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Relent! 'tis cowardly and womanish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to relent is beastly, savage, devilish.</div>
                              <div class="line">Which of you, if you were a prince's son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being pent from liberty, as I am now,</div>
                              <div class="line">if two such murderers as yourselves came to you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would not entreat for life?</div>
                              <div class="line">My friend, I spy some pity in thy looks:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, if thine eye be not a flatterer,</div>
                              <div class="line">Come thou on my side, and entreat for me,</div>
                              <div class="line">As you would beg, were you in my distress</div>
                              <div class="line">A begging prince what beggar pities not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Look behind you, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">Take that, and that: if all this will not do,</div>
                              <p>Stabs him</p>
                              <div class="line">I'll drown you in the malmsey-butt within.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit, with the body</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">A bloody deed, and desperately dispatch'd!</div>
                              <div class="line">How fain, like Pilate, would I wash my hands</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this most grievous guilty murder done!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter First Murderer</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">How now! what mean'st thou, that thou help'st me not?</div>
                              <div class="line">By heavens, the duke shall know how slack thou art!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">I would he knew that I had saved his brother!</div>
                              <div class="line">Take thou the fee, and tell him what I say;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I repent me that the duke is slain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Murderer</div>
                              <div class="line">So do not I: go, coward as thou art.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now must I hide his body in some hole,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until the duke take order for his burial:</div>
                              <div class="line">And when I have my meed, I must away;</div>
                              <div class="line">For this will out, and here I must not stay.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  London. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  London. The palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  London. The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish. Enter KING EDWARD IV sick, QUEEN
ELIZABETH, DORSET, RIVERS, HASTINGS, BUCKINGHAM,
GREY, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so: now have I done a good day's work:</div>
                              <div class="line">You peers, continue this united league:</div>
                              <div class="line">I every day expect an embassage</div>
                              <div class="line">From my Redeemer to redeem me hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now in peace my soul shall part to heaven,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I have set my friends at peace on earth.</div>
                              <div class="line">Rivers and Hastings, take each other's hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">Dissemble not your hatred, swear your love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, my heart is purged from grudging hate:</div>
                              <div class="line">And with my hand I seal my true heart's love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">So thrive I, as I truly swear the like!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Take heed you dally not before your king;</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest he that is the supreme King of kings</div>
                              <div class="line">Confound your hidden falsehood, and award</div>
                              <div class="line">Either of you to be the other's end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">So prosper I, as I swear perfect love!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, as I love Hastings with my heart!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, yourself are not exempt in this,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor your son Dorset, Buckingham, nor you;</div>
                              <div class="line">You have been factious one against the other,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wife, love Lord Hastings, let him kiss your hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">And what you do, do it unfeignedly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, Hastings; I will never more remember</div>
                              <div class="line">Our former hatred, so thrive I and mine!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Dorset, embrace him; Hastings, love lord marquess.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">This interchange of love, I here protest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my part shall be unviolable.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">And so swear I, my lord</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They embrace</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, princely Buckingham, seal thou this league</div>
                              <div class="line">With thy embracements to my wife's allies,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make me happy in your unity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Whenever Buckingham doth turn his hate</div>
                              <div class="line">On you or yours,</div>
                              <p>To the Queen</p>
                              <div class="line">but with all duteous love</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth cherish you and yours, God punish me</div>
                              <div class="line">With hate in those where I expect most love!</div>
                              <div class="line">When I have most need to employ a friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">And most assured that he is a friend</div>
                              <div class="line">Deep, hollow, treacherous, and full of guile,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be he unto me! this do I beg of God,</div>
                              <div class="line">When I am cold in zeal to yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">A pleasing cordial, princely Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">is this thy vow unto my sickly heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">There wanteth now our brother Gloucester here,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make the perfect period of this peace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in good time, here comes the noble duke.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow to my sovereign king and queen:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, princely peers, a happy time of day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Happy, indeed, as we have spent the day.</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother, we done deeds of charity;</div>
                              <div class="line">Made peace enmity, fair love of hate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Between these swelling wrong-incensed peers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">A blessed labour, my most sovereign liege:</div>
                              <div class="line">Amongst this princely heap, if any here,</div>
                              <div class="line">By false intelligence, or wrong surmise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold me a foe;</div>
                              <div class="line">If I unwittingly, or in my rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have aught committed that is hardly borne</div>
                              <div class="line">By any in this presence, I desire</div>
                              <div class="line">To reconcile me to his friendly peace:</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis death to me to be at enmity;</div>
                              <div class="line">I hate it, and desire all good men's love.</div>
                              <div class="line">First, madam, I entreat true peace of you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I will purchase with my duteous service;</div>
                              <div class="line">Of you, my noble cousin Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">If ever any grudge were lodged between us;</div>
                              <div class="line">Of you, Lord Rivers, and, Lord Grey, of you;</div>
                              <div class="line">That without desert have frown'd on me;</div>
                              <div class="line">Dukes, earls, lords, gentlemen; indeed, of all.</div>
                              <div class="line">I do not know that Englishman alive</div>
                              <div class="line">With whom my soul is any jot at odds</div>
                              <div class="line">More than the infant that is born to-night</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank my God for my humility.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">A holy day shall this be kept hereafter:</div>
                              <div class="line">I would to God all strifes were well compounded.</div>
                              <div class="line">My sovereign liege, I do beseech your majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">To take our brother Clarence to your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, madam, have I offer'd love for this</div>
                              <div class="line">To be so bouted in this royal presence?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who knows not that the noble duke is dead?</div>
                              <p>They all start</p>
                              <div class="line">You do him injury to scorn his corse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Who knows not he is dead! who knows he is?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">All seeing heaven, what a world is this!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Look I so pale, Lord Dorset, as the rest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, my good lord; and no one in this presence</div>
                              <div class="line">But his red colour hath forsook his cheeks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Is Clarence dead? the order was reversed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">But he, poor soul, by your first order died,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that a winged Mercury did bear:</div>
                              <div class="line">Some tardy cripple bore the countermand,</div>
                              <div class="line">That came too lag to see him buried.</div>
                              <div class="line">God grant that some, less noble and less loyal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nearer in bloody thoughts, but not in blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Deserve not worse than wretched Clarence did,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet go current from suspicion!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DERBY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">A boon, my sovereign, for my service done!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, peace: my soul is full of sorrow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not rise, unless your highness grant.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Then speak at once what is it thou demand'st.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">The forfeit, sovereign, of my servant's life;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who slew to-day a righteous gentleman</div>
                              <div class="line">Lately attendant on the Duke of Norfolk.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING EDWARD IV</div>
                              <div class="line">Have a tongue to doom my brother's death,</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall the same give pardon to a slave?</div>
                              <div class="line">My brother slew no man; his fault was thought,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet his punishment was cruel death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who sued to me for him? who, in my rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">Kneel'd at my feet, and bade me be advised</div>
                              <div class="line">Who spake of brotherhood? who spake of love?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who told me how the poor soul did forsake</div>
                              <div class="line">The mighty Warwick, and did fight for me?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who told me, in the field by Tewksbury</div>
                              <div class="line">When Oxford had me down, he rescued me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And said, 'Dear brother, live, and be a king'?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who told me, when we both lay in the field</div>
                              <div class="line">Frozen almost to death, how he did lap me</div>
                              <div class="line">Even in his own garments, and gave himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">All thin and naked, to the numb cold night?</div>
                              <div class="line">All this from my remembrance brutish wrath</div>
                              <div class="line">Sinfully pluck'd, and not a man of you</div>
                              <div class="line">Had so much grace to put it in my mind.</div>
                              <div class="line">But when your carters or your waiting-vassals</div>
                              <div class="line">Have done a drunken slaughter, and defaced</div>
                              <div class="line">The precious image of our dear Redeemer,</div>
                              <div class="line">You straight are on your knees for pardon, pardon;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I unjustly too, must grant it you</div>
                              <div class="line">But for my brother not a man would speak,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I, ungracious, speak unto myself</div>
                              <div class="line">For him, poor soul. The proudest of you all</div>
                              <div class="line">Have been beholding to him in his life;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet none of you would once plead for his life.</div>
                              <div class="line">O God, I fear thy justice will take hold</div>
                              <div class="line">On me, and you, and mine, and yours for this!</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Hastings, help me to my closet.</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh, poor Clarence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt some with KING EDWARD IV and QUEEN MARGARET</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the fruit of rashness! Mark'd you not</div>
                              <div class="line">How that the guilty kindred of the queen</div>
                              <div class="line">Look'd pale when they did hear of Clarence' death?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, they did urge it still unto the king!</div>
                              <div class="line">God will revenge it. But come, let us in,</div>
                              <div class="line">To comfort Edward with our company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">We wait upon your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter the DUCHESS OF YORK, with the two children of CLARENCE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me, good grandam, is our father dead?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">No, boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Why do you wring your hands, and beat your breast,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cry 'O Clarence, my unhappy son!'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Girl</div>
                              <div class="line">Why do you look on us, and shake your head,</div>
                              <div class="line">And call us wretches, orphans, castaways</div>
                              <div class="line">If that our noble father be alive?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">My pretty cousins, you mistake me much;</div>
                              <div class="line">I do lament the sickness of the king.</div>
                              <div class="line">As loath to lose him, not your father's death;</div>
                              <div class="line">It were lost sorrow to wail one that's lost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, grandam, you conclude that he is dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">The king my uncle is to blame for this:</div>
                              <div class="line">God will revenge it; whom I will importune</div>
                              <div class="line">With daily prayers all to that effect.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Girl</div>
                              <div class="line">And so will I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, children, peace! the king doth love you well:</div>
                              <div class="line">Incapable and shallow innocents,</div>
                              <div class="line">You cannot guess who caused your father's death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Grandam, we can; for my good uncle Gloucester</div>
                              <div class="line">Told me, the king, provoked by the queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Devised impeachments to imprison him :</div>
                              <div class="line">And when my uncle told me so, he wept,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hugg'd me in his arm, and kindly kiss'd my cheek;</div>
                              <div class="line">Bade me rely on him as on my father,</div>
                              <div class="line">And he would love me dearly as his child.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh, that deceit should steal such gentle shapes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with a virtuous vizard hide foul guile!</div>
                              <div class="line">He is my son; yea, and therein my shame;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet from my dugs he drew not this deceit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Think you my uncle did dissemble, grandam?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot think it. Hark! what noise is this?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter QUEEN ELIZABETH, with her hair about her
ears; RIVERS, and DORSET after her</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh, who shall hinder me to wail and weep,</div>
                              <div class="line">To chide my fortune, and torment myself?</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll join with black despair against my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">And to myself become an enemy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">What means this scene of rude impatience?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">To make an act of tragic violence:</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward, my lord, your son, our king, is dead.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why grow the branches now the root is wither'd?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why wither not the leaves the sap being gone?</div>
                              <div class="line">If you will live, lament; if die, be brief,</div>
                              <div class="line">That our swift-winged souls may catch the king's;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, like obedient subjects, follow him</div>
                              <div class="line">To his new kingdom of perpetual rest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, so much interest have I in thy sorrow</div>
                              <div class="line">As I had title in thy noble husband!</div>
                              <div class="line">I have bewept a worthy husband's death,</div>
                              <div class="line">And lived by looking on his images:</div>
                              <div class="line">But now two mirrors of his princely semblance</div>
                              <div class="line">Are crack'd in pieces by malignant death,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I for comfort have but one false glass,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which grieves me when I see my shame in him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art a widow; yet thou art a mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hast the comfort of thy children left thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">But death hath snatch'd my husband from mine arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">And pluck'd two crutches from my feeble limbs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward and Clarence. O, what cause have I,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thine being but a moiety of my grief,</div>
                              <div class="line">To overgo thy plaints and drown thy cries!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Good aunt, you wept not for our father's death;</div>
                              <div class="line">How can we aid you with our kindred tears?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Girl</div>
                              <div class="line">Our fatherless distress was left unmoan'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">Your widow-dolour likewise be unwept!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me no help in lamentation;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not barren to bring forth complaints</div>
                              <div class="line">All springs reduce their currents to mine eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I, being govern'd by the watery moon,</div>
                              <div class="line">May send forth plenteous tears to drown the world!</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh for my husband, for my dear lord Edward!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Children</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh for our father, for our dear lord Clarence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas for both, both mine, Edward and Clarence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">What stay had I but Edward? and he's gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Children</div>
                              <div class="line">What stay had we but Clarence? and he's gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">What stays had I but they? and they are gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="line">Was never widow had so dear a loss!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Children</div>
                              <div class="line">Were never orphans had so dear a loss!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">Was never mother had so dear a loss!</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, I am the mother of these moans!</div>
                              <div class="line">Their woes are parcell'd, mine are general.</div>
                              <div class="line">She for an Edward weeps, and so do I;</div>
                              <div class="line">I for a Clarence weep, so doth not she:</div>
                              <div class="line">These babes for Clarence weep and so do I;</div>
                              <div class="line">I for an Edward weep, so do not they:</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, you three, on me, threefold distress'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pour all your tears! I am your sorrow's nurse,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will pamper it with lamentations.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DORSET</div>
                              <div class="line">Comfort, dear mother: God is much displeased</div>
                              <div class="line">That you take with unthankfulness, his doing:</div>
                              <div class="line">In common worldly things, 'tis call'd ungrateful,</div>
                              <div class="line">With dull unwilligness to repay a debt</div>
                              <div class="line">Which with a bounteous hand was kindly lent;</div>
                              <div class="line">Much more to be thus opposite with heaven,</div>
                              <div class="line">For it requires the royal debt it lent you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, bethink you, like a careful mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the young prince your son: send straight for him</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him be crown'd; in him your comfort lives:</div>
                              <div class="line">Drown desperate sorrow in dead Edward's grave,</div>
                              <div class="line">And plant your joys in living Edward's throne.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM, DERBY, HASTINGS, and RATCLIFF</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, have comfort: all of us have cause</div>
                              <div class="line">To wail the dimming of our shining star;</div>
                              <div class="line">But none can cure their harms by wailing them.</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, my mother, I do cry you mercy;</div>
                              <div class="line">I did not see your grace: humbly on my knee</div>
                              <div class="line">I crave your blessing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">God bless thee; and put meekness in thy mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">Love, charity, obedience, and true duty!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Amen; and make me die a good old man!</div>
                              <div class="line">That is the butt-end of a mother's blessing:</div>
                              <div class="line">I marvel why her grace did leave it out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">You cloudy princes and heart-sorrowing peers,</div>
                              <div class="line">That bear this mutual heavy load of moan,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now cheer each other in each other's love</div>
                              <div class="line">Though we have spent our harvest of this king,</div>
                              <div class="line">We are to reap the harvest of his son.</div>
                              <div class="line">The broken rancour of your high-swoln hearts,</div>
                              <div class="line">But lately splinter'd, knit, and join'd together,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must gently be preserved, cherish'd, and kept:</div>
                              <div class="line">Me seemeth good, that, with some little train,</div>
                              <div class="line">Forthwith from Ludlow the young prince be fetch'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Hither to London, to be crown'd our king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Why with some little train, my Lord of Buckingham?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, my lord, lest, by a multitude,</div>
                              <div class="line">The new-heal'd wound of malice should break out,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which would be so much the more dangerous</div>
                              <div class="line">By how much the estate is green and yet ungovern'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where every horse bears his commanding rein,</div>
                              <div class="line">And may direct his course as please himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">As well the fear of harm, as harm apparent,</div>
                              <div class="line">In my opinion, ought to be prevented.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I hope the king made peace with all of us</div>
                              <div class="line">And the compact is firm and true in me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">And so in me; and so, I think, in all:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, since it is but green, it should be put</div>
                              <div class="line">To no apparent likelihood of breach,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which haply by much company might be urged:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore I say with noble Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">That it is meet so few should fetch the prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">And so say I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Then be it so; and go we to determine</div>
                              <div class="line">Who they shall be that straight shall post to Ludlow.</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, and you, my mother, will you go</div>
                              <div class="line">To give your censures in this weighty business?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELIZABETH</div>
                              <div class="speaker">DUCHESS OF YORK</div>
                              <div class="line">With all our harts.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but BUCKINGHAM and GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, whoever journeys to the Prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">For God's sake, let not us two be behind;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, by the way, I'll sort occasion,</div>
                              <div class="line">As index to the story we late talk'd of,</div>
                              <div class="line">To part the queen's proud kindred from the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">My other self, my counsel's consistory,</div>
                              <div class="line">My oracle, my prophet! My dear cousin,</div>
                              <div class="line">I, like a child, will go by thy direction.</div>
                              <div class="line">Towards Ludlow then, for we'll not stay behind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  London. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter two Citizens meeting</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Neighbour, well met: whither away so fast?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">I promise you, I scarcely know myself:</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear you the news abroad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that the king is dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Bad news, by'r lady; seldom comes the better:</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear, I fear 'twill prove a troublous world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter another Citizen</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Neighbours, God speed!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Give you good morrow, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth this news hold of good King Edward's death?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, sir, it is too true; God help the while!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, masters, look to see a troublous world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no; by God's good grace his son shall reign.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Woe to the land that's govern'd by a child!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Second Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">In him there is a hope of government,</div>
                              <div class="line">That in his nonage council under him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in his full and ripen'd years himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">No doubt, shall then and till then govern well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">So stood the state when Henry the Sixth</div>
                              <div class="line">Was crown'd in Paris but at nine months old.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Stood the state so? No, no, good friends, God wot;</div>
                              <div class="line">For then this land was famously enrich'd</div>
                              <div class="line">With politic grave counsel; then the king</div>
                              <div class="line">Had virtuous uncles to protect his grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, so hath this, both by the father and mother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Third Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Better it were they all came by the father,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or by the father there were none at all;</div>
                              <div class="line">For emulation now, who shall be nearest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will touch us all too near, if God prevent not.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, full of danger is the Duke of Gloucester!</div>
                              <div class="line">And the queen's sons and brothers haught and proud:</div>
                              <div class="line">And were they to be ruled, and not to rule,</div>
                              <div class="line">This sickly land might solace as before.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
