                              <div class="line">Gramercy, fellow: there, drink that for me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Throws him his purse</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Pursuivant</div>
                              <div class="line">God save your lordship!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <p>Enter a Priest</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Priest</div>
                              <div class="line">Well met, my lord; I am glad to see your honour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee, good Sir John, with all my heart.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am in your debt for your last exercise;</div>
                              <div class="line">Come the next Sabbath, and I will content you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He whispers in his ear</p>
                        <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">What, talking with a priest, lord chamberlain?</div>
                              <div class="line">Your friends at Pomfret, they do need the priest;</div>
                              <div class="line">Your honour hath no shriving work in hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good faith, and when I met this holy man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Those men you talk of came into my mind.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, go you toward the Tower?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I do, my lord; but long I shall not stay</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall return before your lordship thence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis like enough, for I stay dinner there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  And supper too, although thou know'st it not.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, will you go?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll wait upon your lordship.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Pomfret Castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter RATCLIFF, with halberds, carrying RIVERS,
GREY, and VAUGHAN to death</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, bring forth the prisoners.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Richard Ratcliff, let me tell thee this:</div>
                              <div class="line">To-day shalt thou behold a subject die</div>
                              <div class="line">For truth, for duty, and for loyalty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                              <div class="line">God keep the prince from all the pack of you!</div>
                              <div class="line">A knot you are of damned blood-suckers!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">VAUGHAN</div>
                              <div class="line">You live that shall cry woe for this after.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispatch; the limit of your lives is out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">O Pomfret, Pomfret! O thou bloody prison,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fatal and ominous to noble peers!</div>
                              <div class="line">Within the guilty closure of thy walls</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard the second here was hack'd to death;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, for more slander to thy dismal seat,</div>
                              <div class="line">We give thee up our guiltless blood to drink.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GREY</div>
                              <div class="line">Now Margaret's curse is fall'n upon our heads,</div>
                              <div class="line">For standing by when Richard stabb'd her son.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Then cursed she Hastings, then cursed she Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">Then cursed she Richard. O, remember, God</div>
                              <div class="line">To hear her prayers for them, as now for us</div>
                              <div class="line">And for my sister and her princely sons,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be satisfied, dear God, with our true blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, as thou know'st, unjustly must be spilt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Make haste; the hour of death is expiate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Grey, come, Vaughan, let us all embrace:</div>
                              <div class="line">And take our leave, until we meet in heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The Tower of London.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter BUCKINGHAM, DERBY, HASTINGS, the BISHOP OF
ELY, RATCLIFF, LOVEL, with others, and take their
seats at a table</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">My lords, at once: the cause why we are met</div>
                              <div class="line">Is, to determine of the coronation.</div>
                              <div class="line">In God's name, speak: when is the royal day?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Are all things fitting for that royal time?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">It is, and wants but nomination.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow, then, I judge a happy day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Who knows the lord protector's mind herein?</div>
                              <div class="line">Who is most inward with the royal duke?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace, we think, should soonest know his mind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, I, my lord I we know each other's faces,</div>
                              <div class="line">But for our hearts, he knows no more of mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than I of yours;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I no more of his, than you of mine.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Hastings, you and he are near in love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank his grace, I know he loves me well;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, for his purpose in the coronation.</div>
                              <div class="line">I have not sounded him, nor he deliver'd</div>
                              <div class="line">His gracious pleasure any way therein:</div>
                              <div class="line">But you, my noble lords, may name the time;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the duke's behalf I'll give my voice,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, I presume, he'll take in gentle part.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                              <div class="line">Now in good time, here comes the duke himself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">My noble lords and cousins all, good morrow.</div>
                              <div class="line">I have been long a sleeper; but, I hope,</div>
                              <div class="line">My absence doth neglect no great designs,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which by my presence might have been concluded.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Had not you come upon your cue, my lord</div>
                              <div class="line">William Lord Hastings had pronounced your part,--</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, your voice,--for crowning of the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Than my Lord Hastings no man might be bolder;</div>
                              <div class="line">His lordship knows me well, and loves me well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord of Ely!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">When I was last in Holborn,</div>
                              <div class="line">I saw good strawberries in your garden there</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you send for some of them.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, and will, my lord, with all my heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Cousin of Buckingham, a word with you.</div>
                              <p>Drawing him aside</p>
                              <div class="line">Catesby hath sounded Hastings in our business,</div>
                              <div class="line">And finds the testy gentleman so hot,</div>
                              <div class="line">As he will lose his head ere give consent</div>
                              <div class="line">His master's son, as worshipful as he terms it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall lose the royalty of England's throne.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Withdraw you hence, my lord, I'll follow you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit GLOUCESTER, BUCKINGHAM following</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">We have not yet set down this day of triumph.</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow, in mine opinion, is too sudden;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I myself am not so well provided</div>
                              <div class="line">As else I would be, were the day prolong'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter BISHOP OF ELY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BISHOP OF ELY</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is my lord protector? I have sent for these</div>
                              <div class="line">strawberries.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">His grace looks cheerfully and smooth to-day;</div>
                              <div class="line">There's some conceit or other likes him well,</div>
                              <div class="line">When he doth bid good morrow with such a spirit.</div>
                              <div class="line">I think there's never a man in Christendom</div>
                              <div class="line">That can less hide his love or hate than he;</div>
                              <div class="line">For by his face straight shall you know his heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">What of his heart perceive you in his face</div>
                              <div class="line">By any likelihood he show'd to-day?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, that with no man here he is offended;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, were he, he had shown it in his looks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray God he be not, I say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you all, tell me what they deserve</div>
                              <div class="line">That do conspire my death with devilish plots</div>
                              <div class="line">Of damned witchcraft, and that have prevail'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my body with their hellish charms?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">The tender love I bear your grace, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes me most forward in this noble presence</div>
                              <div class="line">To doom the offenders, whatsoever they be</div>
                              <div class="line">I say, my lord, they have deserved death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Then be your eyes the witness of this ill:</div>
                              <div class="line">See how I am bewitch'd; behold mine arm</div>
                              <div class="line">Is, like a blasted sapling, wither'd up:</div>
                              <div class="line">And this is Edward's wife, that monstrous witch,</div>
                              <div class="line">Consorted with that harlot strumpet Shore,</div>
                              <div class="line">That by their witchcraft thus have marked me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">If they have done this thing, my gracious lord--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">If I thou protector of this damned strumpet--</div>
                              <div class="line">Tellest thou me of 'ifs'?  Thou art a traitor:</div>
                              <div class="line">Off with his head! Now, by Saint Paul I swear,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not dine until I see the same.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lovel and Ratcliff, look that it be done:</div>
                              <div class="line">The rest, that love me, rise and follow me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but HASTINGS, RATCLIFF, and LOVEL</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">Woe, woe for England! not a whit for me;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I, too fond, might have prevented this.</div>
                              <div class="line">Stanley did dream the boar did raze his helm;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I disdain'd it, and did scorn to fly:</div>
                              <div class="line">Three times to-day my foot-cloth horse did stumble,</div>
                              <div class="line">And startled, when he look'd upon the Tower,</div>
                              <div class="line">As loath to bear me to the slaughter-house.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, now I want the priest that spake to me:</div>
                              <div class="line">I now repent I told the pursuivant</div>
                              <div class="line">As 'twere triumphing at mine enemies,</div>
                              <div class="line">How they at Pomfret bloodily were butcher'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I myself secure in grace and favour.</div>
                              <div class="line">O Margaret, Margaret, now thy heavy curse</div>
                              <div class="line">Is lighted on poor Hastings' wretched head!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispatch, my lord; the duke would be at dinner:</div>
                              <div class="line">Make a short shrift; he longs to see your head.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">O momentary grace of mortal men,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which we more hunt for than the grace of God!</div>
                              <div class="line">Who builds his hopes in air of your good looks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lives like a drunken sailor on a mast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ready, with every nod, to tumble down</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the fatal bowels of the deep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LOVEL</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come, dispatch; 'tis bootless to exclaim.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">O bloody Richard! miserable England!</div>
                              <div class="line">I prophesy the fearful'st time to thee</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever wretched age hath look'd upon.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, lead me to the block; bear him my head.</div>
                              <div class="line">They smile at me that shortly shall be dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  The Tower-walls.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM, in rotten armour,
marvellous ill-favoured</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, cousin, canst thou quake, and change thy colour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Murder thy breath in the middle of a word,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then begin again, and stop again,</div>
                              <div class="line">As if thou wert distraught and mad with terror?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Tut, I can counterfeit the deep tragedian;</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak and look back, and pry on every side,</div>
                              <div class="line">Tremble and start at wagging of a straw,</div>
                              <div class="line">Intending deep suspicion: ghastly looks</div>
                              <div class="line">Are at my service, like enforced smiles;</div>
                              <div class="line">And both are ready in their offices,</div>
                              <div class="line">At any time, to grace my stratagems.</div>
                              <div class="line">But what, is Catesby gone?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">He is; and, see, he brings the mayor along.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Lord Mayor and CATESBY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord mayor,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Look to the drawbridge there!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Hark! a drum.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Catesby, o'erlook the walls.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord mayor, the reason we have sent--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Look back, defend thee, here are enemies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">God and our innocency defend and guard us!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Be patient, they are friends, Ratcliff and Lovel.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter LOVEL and RATCLIFF, with HASTINGS' head</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LOVEL</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is the head of that ignoble traitor,</div>
                              <div class="line">The dangerous and unsuspected Hastings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">So dear I loved the man, that I must weep.</div>
                              <div class="line">I took him for the plainest harmless creature</div>
                              <div class="line">That breathed upon this earth a Christian;</div>
                              <div class="line">Made him my book wherein my soul recorded</div>
                              <div class="line">The history of all her secret thoughts:</div>
                              <div class="line">So smooth he daub'd his vice with show of virtue,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, his apparent open guilt omitted,</div>
                              <div class="line">I mean, his conversation with Shore's wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">He lived from all attainder of suspect.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, well, he was the covert'st shelter'd traitor</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever lived.</div>
                              <div class="line">Would you imagine, or almost believe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were't not that, by great preservation,</div>
                              <div class="line">We live to tell it you, the subtle traitor</div>
                              <div class="line">This day had plotted, in the council-house</div>
                              <div class="line">To murder me and my good Lord of Gloucester?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">What, had he so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What, think You we are Turks or infidels?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or that we would, against the form of law,</div>
                              <div class="line">Proceed thus rashly to the villain's death,</div>
                              <div class="line">But that the extreme peril of the case,</div>
                              <div class="line">The peace of England and our persons' safety,</div>
                              <div class="line">Enforced us to this execution?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, fair befall you! he deserved his death;</div>
                              <div class="line">And you my good lords, both have well proceeded,</div>
                              <div class="line">To warn false traitors from the like attempts.</div>
                              <div class="line">I never look'd for better at his hands,</div>
                              <div class="line">After he once fell in with Mistress Shore.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet had not we determined he should die,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until your lordship came to see his death;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which now the loving haste of these our friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">Somewhat against our meaning, have prevented:</div>
                              <div class="line">Because, my lord, we would have had you heard</div>
                              <div class="line">The traitor speak, and timorously confess</div>
                              <div class="line">The manner and the purpose of his treason;</div>
                              <div class="line">That you might well have signified the same</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the citizens, who haply may</div>
                              <div class="line">Misconstrue us in him and wail his death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">But, my good lord, your grace's word shall serve,</div>
                              <div class="line">As well as I had seen and heard him speak</div>
                              <div class="line">And doubt you not, right noble princes both,</div>
                              <div class="line">But I'll acquaint our duteous citizens</div>
                              <div class="line">With all your just proceedings in this cause.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">And to that end we wish'd your lord-ship here,</div>
                              <div class="line">To avoid the carping censures of the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">But since you come too late of our intents,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet witness what you hear we did intend:</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, my good lord mayor, we bid farewell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit Lord Mayor</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, after, after, cousin Buckingham.</div>
                              <div class="line">The mayor towards Guildhall hies him in all post:</div>
                              <div class="line">There, at your meet'st advantage of the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Infer the bastardy of Edward's children:</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell them how Edward put to death a citizen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Only for saying he would make his son</div>
                              <div class="line">Heir to the crown; meaning indeed his house,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, by the sign thereof was termed so.</div>
                              <div class="line">Moreover, urge his hateful luxury</div>
                              <div class="line">And bestial appetite in change of lust;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which stretched to their servants, daughters, wives,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even where his lustful eye or savage heart,</div>
                              <div class="line">Without control, listed to make his prey.</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, for a need, thus far come near my person:</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell them, when that my mother went with child</div>
                              <div class="line">Of that unsatiate Edward, noble York</div>
                              <div class="line">My princely father then had wars in France</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by just computation of the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Found that the issue was not his begot;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which well appeared in his lineaments,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being nothing like the noble duke my father:</div>
                              <div class="line">But touch this sparingly, as 'twere far off,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because you know, my lord, my mother lives.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Fear not, my lord, I'll play the orator</div>
                              <div class="line">As if the golden fee for which I plead</div>
                              <div class="line">Were for myself: and so, my lord, adieu.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">If you thrive well, bring them to Baynard's Castle;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where you shall find me well accompanied</div>
                              <div class="line">With reverend fathers and well-learned bishops.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I go: and towards three or four o'clock</div>
                              <div class="line">Look for the news that the Guildhall affords.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit BUCKINGHAM</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, Lovel, with all speed to Doctor Shaw;</div>
                              <p>To CATESBY</p>
                              <div class="line">Go thou to Friar Penker; bid them both</div>
                              <div class="line">Meet me within this hour at Baynard's Castle.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt all but GLOUCESTER</p>
                              <div class="line">Now will I in, to take some privy order,</div>
                              <div class="line">To draw the brats of Clarence out of sight;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to give notice, that no manner of person</div>
                              <div class="line">At any time have recourse unto the princes.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.7">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>6. SCENE VI.  The same.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter a Scrivener, with a paper in his hand</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Scrivener</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the indictment of the good Lord Hastings;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which in a set hand fairly is engross'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">That it may be this day read over in Paul's.</div>
                              <div class="line">And mark how well the sequel hangs together:</div>
                              <div class="line">Eleven hours I spent to write it over,</div>
                              <div class="line">For yesternight by Catesby was it brought me;</div>
                              <div class="line">The precedent was full as long a-doing:</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet within these five hours lived Lord Hastings,</div>
                              <div class="line">Untainted, unexamined, free, at liberty</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's a good world the while! Why who's so gross,</div>
                              <div class="line">That seeth not this palpable device?</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet who's so blind, but says he sees it not?</div>
                              <div class="line">Bad is the world; and all will come to nought,</div>
                              <div class="line">When such bad dealings must be seen in thought.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.8">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Baynard's Castle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER and BUCKINGHAM, at several doors</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, my lord, what say the citizens?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by the holy mother of our Lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">The citizens are mum and speak not a word.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Touch'd you the bastardy of Edward's children?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I did; with his contract with Lady Lucy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And his contract by deputy in France;</div>
                              <div class="line">The insatiate greediness of his desires,</div>
                              <div class="line">And his enforcement of the city wives;</div>
                              <div class="line">His tyranny for trifles; his own bastardy,</div>
                              <div class="line">As being got, your father then in France,</div>
                              <div class="line">His resemblance, being not like the duke;</div>
                              <div class="line">Withal I did infer your lineaments,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being the right idea of your father,</div>
                              <div class="line">Both in your form and nobleness of mind;</div>
                              <div class="line">Laid open all your victories in Scotland,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your dicipline in war, wisdom in peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your bounty, virtue, fair humility:</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, left nothing fitting for the purpose</div>
                              <div class="line">Untouch'd, or slightly handled, in discourse</div>
                              <div class="line">And when mine oratory grew to an end</div>
                              <div class="line">I bid them that did love their country's good</div>
                              <div class="line">Cry 'God save Richard, England's royal king!'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah! and did they so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">No, so God help me, they spake not a word;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, like dumb statues or breathing stones,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gazed each on other, and look'd deadly pale.</div>
                              <div class="line">Which when I saw, I reprehended them;</div>
                              <div class="line">And ask'd the mayor what meant this wilful silence:</div>
                              <div class="line">His answer was, the people were not wont</div>
                              <div class="line">To be spoke to but by the recorder.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then he was urged to tell my tale again,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Thus saith the duke, thus hath the duke inferr'd;'</div>
                              <div class="line">But nothing spake in warrant from himself.</div>
                              <div class="line">When he had done, some followers of mine own,</div>
                              <div class="line">At the lower end of the hall, hurl'd up their caps,</div>
                              <div class="line">And some ten voices cried 'God save King Richard!'</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus I took the vantage of those few,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Thanks, gentle citizens and friends,' quoth I;</div>
                              <div class="line">'This general applause and loving shout</div>
                              <div class="line">Argues your wisdoms and your love to Richard:'</div>
                              <div class="line">And even here brake off, and came away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">What tongueless blocks were they! would not they speak?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">No, by my troth, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not the mayor then and his brethren come?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">The mayor is here at hand: intend some fear;</div>
                              <div class="line">Be not you spoke with, but by mighty suit:</div>
                              <div class="line">And look you get a prayer-book in your hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stand betwixt two churchmen, good my lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">For on that ground I'll build a holy descant:</div>
                              <div class="line">And be not easily won to our request:</div>
                              <div class="line">Play the maid's part, still answer nay, and take it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I go; and if you plead as well for them</div>
                              <div class="line">As I can say nay to thee for myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">No doubt well bring it to a happy issue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, go, up to the leads; the lord mayor knocks.</div>
                              <p>Exit GLOUCESTER</p>
                              <p>Enter the Lord Mayor and Citizens</p>
                              <div class="line">Welcome my lord; I dance attendance here;</div>
                              <div class="line">I think the duke will not be spoke withal.</div>
                              <p>Enter CATESBY</p>
                              <div class="line">Here comes his servant: how now, Catesby,</div>
                              <div class="line">What says he?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord: he doth entreat your grace;</div>
                              <div class="line">To visit him to-morrow or next day:</div>
                              <div class="line">He is within, with two right reverend fathers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Divinely bent to meditation;</div>
                              <div class="line">And no worldly suit would he be moved,</div>
                              <div class="line">To draw him from his holy exercise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Return, good Catesby, to thy lord again;</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him, myself, the mayor and citizens,</div>
                              <div class="line">In deep designs and matters of great moment,</div>
                              <div class="line">No less importing than our general good,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are come to have some conference with his grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell him what you say, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, ha, my lord, this prince is not an Edward!</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not lolling on a lewd day-bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">But on his knees at meditation;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not dallying with a brace of courtezans,</div>
                              <div class="line">But meditating with two deep divines;</div>
                              <div class="line">Not sleeping, to engross his idle body,</div>
                              <div class="line">But praying, to enrich his watchful soul:</div>
                              <div class="line">Happy were England, would this gracious prince</div>
                              <div class="line">Take on himself the sovereignty thereof:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, sure, I fear, we shall ne'er win him to it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, God forbid his grace should say us nay!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">I fear he will.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter CATESBY</p>
                              <div class="line">How now, Catesby, what says your lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">He wonders to what end you have assembled</div>
                              <div class="line">Such troops of citizens to speak with him,</div>
                              <div class="line">His grace not being warn'd thereof before:</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, he fears you mean no good to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Sorry I am my noble cousin should</div>
                              <div class="line">Suspect me, that I mean no good to him:</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I come in perfect love to him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so once more return and tell his grace.</div>
                              <p>Exit CATESBY</p>
                              <div class="line">When holy and devout religious men</div>
                              <div class="line">Are at their beads, 'tis hard to draw them thence,</div>
                              <div class="line">So sweet is zealous contemplation.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GLOUCESTER aloft, between two Bishops.
CATESBY returns</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">See, where he stands between two clergymen!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Two props of virtue for a Christian prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">To stay him from the fall of vanity:</div>
                              <div class="line">And, see, a book of prayer in his hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">True ornaments to know a holy man.</div>
                              <div class="line">Famous Plantagenet, most gracious prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lend favourable ears to our request;</div>
                              <div class="line">And pardon us the interruption</div>
                              <div class="line">Of thy devotion and right Christian zeal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, there needs no such apology:</div>
                              <div class="line">I rather do beseech you pardon me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, earnest in the service of my God,</div>
                              <div class="line">Neglect the visitation of my friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, leaving this, what is your grace's pleasure?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Even that, I hope, which pleaseth God above,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all good men of this ungovern'd isle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I do suspect I have done some offence</div>
                              <div class="line">That seems disgracious in the city's eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that you come to reprehend my ignorance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">You have, my lord: would it might please your grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">At our entreaties, to amend that fault!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Else wherefore breathe I in a Christian land?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Then know, it is your fault that you resign</div>
                              <div class="line">The supreme seat, the throne majestical,</div>
                              <div class="line">The scepter'd office of your ancestors,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your state of fortune and your due of birth,</div>
                              <div class="line">The lineal glory of your royal house,</div>
                              <div class="line">To the corruption of a blemished stock:</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst, in the mildness of your sleepy thoughts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which here we waken to our country's good,</div>
                              <div class="line">This noble isle doth want her proper limbs;</div>
                              <div class="line">Her face defaced with scars of infamy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her royal stock graft with ignoble plants,</div>
                              <div class="line">And almost shoulder'd in the swallowing gulf</div>
                              <div class="line">Of blind forgetfulness and dark oblivion.</div>
                              <div class="line">Which to recure, we heartily solicit</div>
                              <div class="line">Your gracious self to take on you the charge</div>
                              <div class="line">And kingly government of this your land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not as protector, steward, substitute,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or lowly factor for another's gain;</div>
                              <div class="line">But as successively from blood to blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your right of birth, your empery, your own.</div>
                              <div class="line">For this, consorted with the citizens,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your very worshipful and loving friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by their vehement instigation,</div>
                              <div class="line">In this just suit come I to move your grace.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">I know not whether to depart in silence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or bitterly to speak in your reproof.</div>
                              <div class="line">Best fitteth my degree or your condition</div>
                              <div class="line">If not to answer, you might haply think</div>
                              <div class="line">Tongue-tied ambition, not replying, yielded</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear the golden yoke of sovereignty,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which fondly you would here impose on me;</div>
                              <div class="line">If to reprove you for this suit of yours,</div>
                              <div class="line">So season'd with your faithful love to me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, on the other side, I cheque'd my friends.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, to speak, and to avoid the first,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then, in speaking, not to incur the last,</div>
                              <div class="line">Definitively thus I answer you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your love deserves my thanks; but my desert</div>
                              <div class="line">Unmeritable shuns your high request.</div>
                              <div class="line">First if all obstacles were cut away,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that my path were even to the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">As my ripe revenue and due by birth</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet so much is my poverty of spirit,</div>
                              <div class="line">So mighty and so many my defects,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I had rather hide me from my greatness,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being a bark to brook no mighty sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than in my greatness covet to be hid,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the vapour of my glory smother'd.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, God be thank'd, there's no need of me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And much I need to help you, if need were;</div>
                              <div class="line">The royal tree hath left us royal fruit,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, mellow'd by the stealing hours of time,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will well become the seat of majesty,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make, no doubt, us happy by his reign.</div>
                              <div class="line">On him I lay what you would lay on me,</div>
                              <div class="line">The right and fortune of his happy stars;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which God defend that I should wring from him!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, this argues conscience in your grace;</div>
                              <div class="line">But the respects thereof are nice and trivial,</div>
                              <div class="line">All circumstances well considered.</div>
                              <div class="line">You say that Edward is your brother's son:</div>
                              <div class="line">So say we too, but not by Edward's wife;</div>
                              <div class="line">For first he was contract to Lady Lucy--</div>
                              <div class="line">Your mother lives a witness to that vow--</div>
                              <div class="line">And afterward by substitute betroth'd</div>
                              <div class="line">To Bona, sister to the King of France.</div>
                              <div class="line">These both put by a poor petitioner,</div>
                              <div class="line">A care-crazed mother of a many children,</div>
                              <div class="line">A beauty-waning and distressed widow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even in the afternoon of her best days,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made prize and purchase of his lustful eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seduced the pitch and height of all his thoughts</div>
                              <div class="line">To base declension and loathed bigamy</div>
                              <div class="line">By her, in his unlawful bed, he got</div>
                              <div class="line">This Edward, whom our manners term the prince.</div>
                              <div class="line">More bitterly could I expostulate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Save that, for reverence to some alive,</div>
                              <div class="line">I give a sparing limit to my tongue.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, good my lord, take to your royal self</div>
                              <div class="line">This proffer'd benefit of dignity;</div>
                              <div class="line">If non to bless us and the land withal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet to draw forth your noble ancestry</div>
                              <div class="line">From the corruption of abusing times,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto a lineal true-derived course.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Lord Mayor</div>
                              <div class="line">Do, good my lord, your citizens entreat you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Refuse not, mighty lord, this proffer'd love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">O, make them joyful, grant their lawful suit!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Alas, why would you heap these cares on me?</div>
                              <div class="line">I am unfit for state and majesty;</div>
                              <div class="line">I do beseech you, take it not amiss;</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot nor I will not yield to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">If you refuse it,--as, in love and zeal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Loath to depose the child, Your brother's son;</div>
                              <div class="line">As well we know your tenderness of heart</div>
                              <div class="line">And gentle, kind, effeminate remorse,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which we have noted in you to your kin,</div>
                              <div class="line">And egally indeed to all estates,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet whether you accept our suit or no,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your brother's son shall never reign our king;</div>
                              <div class="line">But we will plant some other in the throne,</div>
                              <div class="line">To the disgrace and downfall of your house:</div>
                              <div class="line">And in this resolution here we leave you.--</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, citizens: 'zounds! I'll entreat no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">O, do not swear, my lord of Buckingham.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit BUCKINGHAM with the Citizens</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">Call them again, my lord, and accept their suit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANOTHER</div>
                              <div class="line">Do, good my lord, lest all the land do rue it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GLOUCESTER</div>
                              <div class="line">Would you enforce me to a world of care?</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, call them again. I am not made of stone,</div>
                              <div class="line">But penetrable to your. kind entreats,</div>
                              <div class="line">Albeit against my conscience and my soul.</div>
                              <p>Re-enter BUCKINGHAM and the rest</p>
                              <div class="line">Cousin of Buckingham, and you sage, grave men,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since you will buckle fortune on my back,</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear her burthen, whether I will or no,</div>
