                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Salisbury. An open place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  The camp near Tamworth.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  Bosworth Field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Salisbury. An open place.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter the Sheriff, and BUCKINGHAM, with halberds,
led to execution</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Will not King Richard let me speak with him?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my good lord; therefore be patient.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Hastings, and Edward's children, Rivers, Grey,</div>
                              <div class="line">Holy King Henry, and thy fair son Edward,</div>
                              <div class="line">Vaughan, and all that have miscarried</div>
                              <div class="line">By underhand corrupted foul injustice,</div>
                              <div class="line">If that your moody discontented souls</div>
                              <div class="line">Do through the clouds behold this present hour,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even for revenge mock my destruction!</div>
                              <div class="line">This is All-Souls' day, fellows, is it not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Sheriff</div>
                              <div class="line">It is, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then All-Souls' day is my body's doomsday.</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the day that, in King Edward's time,</div>
                              <div class="line">I wish't might fall on me, when I was found</div>
                              <div class="line">False to his children or his wife's allies</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the day wherein I wish'd to fall</div>
                              <div class="line">By the false faith of him I trusted most;</div>
                              <div class="line">This, this All-Souls' day to my fearful soul</div>
                              <div class="line">Is the determined respite of my wrongs:</div>
                              <div class="line">That high All-Seer that I dallied with</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath turn'd my feigned prayer on my head</div>
                              <div class="line">And given in earnest what I begg'd in jest.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus doth he force the swords of wicked men</div>
                              <div class="line">To turn their own points on their masters' bosoms:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now Margaret's curse is fallen upon my head;</div>
                              <div class="line">'When he,' quoth she, 'shall split thy heart with sorrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember Margaret was a prophetess.'</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, sirs, convey me to the block of shame;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wrong hath but wrong, and blame the due of blame.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The camp near Tamworth.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter RICHMOND, OXFORD, BLUNT, HERBERT, and others,
with drum and colours</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Fellows in arms, and my most loving friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bruised underneath the yoke of tyranny,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus far into the bowels of the land</div>
                              <div class="line">Have we march'd on without impediment;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here receive we from our father Stanley</div>
                              <div class="line">Lines of fair comfort and encouragement.</div>
                              <div class="line">The wretched, bloody, and usurping boar,</div>
                              <div class="line">That spoil'd your summer fields and fruitful vines,</div>
                              <div class="line">Swills your warm blood like wash, and makes his trough</div>
                              <div class="line">In your embowell'd bosoms, this foul swine</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies now even in the centre of this isle,</div>
                              <div class="line">Near to the town of Leicester, as we learn</div>
                              <div class="line">From Tamworth thither is but one day's march.</div>
                              <div class="line">In God's name, cheerly on, courageous friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">To reap the harvest of perpetual peace</div>
                              <div class="line">By this one bloody trial of sharp war.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">OXFORD</div>
                              <div class="line">Every man's conscience is a thousand swords,</div>
                              <div class="line">To fight against that bloody homicide.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HERBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">I doubt not but his friends will fly to us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BLUNT</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath no friends but who are friends for fear.</div>
                              <div class="line">Which in his greatest need will shrink from him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">All for our vantage. Then, in God's name, march:</div>
                              <div class="line">True hope is swift, and flies with swallow's wings:</div>
                              <div class="line">Kings it makes gods, and meaner creatures kings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Bosworth Field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING RICHARD III in arms, with NORFOLK,
SURREY, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Here pitch our tents, even here in Bosworth field.</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Surrey, why look you so sad?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SURREY</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart is ten times lighter than my looks.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Norfolk,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, most gracious liege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Norfolk, we must have knocks; ha! must we not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">We must both give and take, my gracious lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Up with my tent there! here will I lie tonight;</div>
                              <div class="line">But where to-morrow?  Well, all's one for that.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who hath descried the number of the foe?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Six or seven thousand is their utmost power.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, our battalion trebles that account:</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, the king's name is a tower of strength,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which they upon the adverse party want.</div>
                              <div class="line">Up with my tent there! Valiant gentlemen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us survey the vantage of the field</div>
                              <div class="line">Call for some men of sound direction</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's want no discipline, make no delay,</div>
                              <div class="line">For, lords, to-morrow is a busy day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Enter, on the other side of the field, RICHMOND,
Sir William Brandon, OXFORD, and others. Some of
the Soldiers pitch RICHMOND's tent</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">The weary sun hath made a golden set,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by the bright track of his fiery car,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gives signal, of a goodly day to-morrow.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir William Brandon, you shall bear my standard.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me some ink and paper in my tent</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll draw the form and model of our battle,</div>
                              <div class="line">Limit each leader to his several charge,</div>
                              <div class="line">And part in just proportion our small strength.</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord of Oxford, you, Sir William Brandon,</div>
                              <div class="line">And you, Sir Walter Herbert, stay with me.</div>
                              <div class="line">The Earl of Pembroke keeps his regiment:</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Captain Blunt, bear my good night to him</div>
                              <div class="line">And by the second hour in the morning</div>
                              <div class="line">Desire the earl to see me in my tent:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet one thing more, good Blunt, before thou go'st,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is Lord Stanley quarter'd, dost thou know?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BLUNT</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless I have mista'en his colours much,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which well I am assured I have not done,</div>
                              <div class="line">His regiment lies half a mile at least</div>
                              <div class="line">South from the mighty power of the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">If without peril it be possible,</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Captain Blunt, bear my good-night to him,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give him from me this most needful scroll.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BLUNT</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my life, my lord, I'll under-take it;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, God give you quiet rest to-night!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Good night, good Captain Blunt. Come gentlemen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us consult upon to-morrow's business</div>
                              <div class="line">In to our tent; the air is raw and cold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>They withdraw into the tent</p>
                        <p>Enter, to his tent, KING RICHARD III, NORFOLK,
RATCLIFF, CATESBY, and others</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">What is't o'clock?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">It's supper-time, my lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">It's nine o'clock.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not sup to-night.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me some ink and paper.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, is my beaver easier than it was?</div>
                              <div class="line">And all my armour laid into my tent?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">If is, my liege; and all things are in readiness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Good Norfolk, hie thee to thy charge;</div>
                              <div class="line">Use careful watch, choose trusty sentinels.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I go, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Stir with the lark to-morrow, gentle Norfolk.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">I warrant you, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Catesby!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Send out a pursuivant at arms</div>
                              <div class="line">To Stanley's regiment; bid him bring his power</div>
                              <div class="line">Before sunrising, lest his son George fall</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the blind cave of eternal night.</div>
                              <p>Exit CATESBY</p>
                              <div class="line">Fill me a bowl of wine. Give me a watch.</div>
                              <div class="line">Saddle white Surrey for the field to-morrow.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look that my staves be sound, and not too heavy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ratcliff!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Saw'st thou the melancholy Lord Northumberland?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Thomas the Earl of Surrey, and himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Much about cock-shut time, from troop to troop</div>
                              <div class="line">Went through the army, cheering up the soldiers.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">So, I am satisfied. Give me a bowl of wine:</div>
                              <div class="line">I have not that alacrity of spirit,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor cheer of mind, that I was wont to have.</div>
                              <div class="line">Set it down. Is ink and paper ready?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">It is, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid my guard watch; leave me.</div>
                              <div class="line">Ratcliff, about the mid of night come to my tent</div>
                              <div class="line">And help to arm me. Leave me, I say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt RATCLIFF and the other Attendants</p>
                        <p>Enter DERBY to RICHMOND in his tent, Lords and
others attending</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">Fortune and victory sit on thy helm!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">All comfort that the dark night can afford</div>
                              <div class="line">Be to thy person, noble father-in-law!</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me, how fares our loving mother?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">I, by attorney, bless thee from thy mother</div>
                              <div class="line">Who prays continually for Richmond's good:</div>
                              <div class="line">So much for that. The silent hours steal on,</div>
                              <div class="line">And flaky darkness breaks within the east.</div>
                              <div class="line">In brief,--for so the season bids us be,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Prepare thy battle early in the morning,</div>
                              <div class="line">And put thy fortune to the arbitrement</div>
                              <div class="line">Of bloody strokes and mortal-staring war.</div>
                              <div class="line">I, as I may--that which I would I cannot,--</div>
                              <div class="line">With best advantage will deceive the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">And aid thee in this doubtful shock of arms:</div>
                              <div class="line">But on thy side I may not be too forward</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest, being seen, thy brother, tender George,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be executed in his father's sight.</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell: the leisure and the fearful time</div>
                              <div class="line">Cuts off the ceremonious vows of love</div>
                              <div class="line">And ample interchange of sweet discourse,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which so long sunder'd friends should dwell upon:</div>
                              <div class="line">God give us leisure for these rites of love!</div>
                              <div class="line">Once more, adieu: be valiant, and speed well!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Good lords, conduct him to his regiment:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll strive, with troubled thoughts, to take a nap,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest leaden slumber peise me down to-morrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">When I should mount with wings of victory:</div>
                              <div class="line">Once more, good night, kind lords and gentlemen.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt all but RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">O Thou, whose captain I account myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Look on my forces with a gracious eye;</div>
                              <div class="line">Put in their hands thy bruising irons of wrath,</div>
                              <div class="line">That they may crush down with a heavy fall</div>
                              <div class="line">The usurping helmets of our adversaries!</div>
                              <div class="line">Make us thy ministers of chastisement,</div>
                              <div class="line">That we may praise thee in the victory!</div>
                              <div class="line">To thee I do commend my watchful soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere I let fall the windows of mine eyes:</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleeping and waking, O, defend me still!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Sleeps</p>
                        <p>Enter the Ghost of Prince Edward, son to King Henry VI</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of Prince Edward</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Let me sit heavy on thy soul to-morrow!</div>
                              <div class="line">Think, how thou stab'dst me in my prime of youth</div>
                              <div class="line">At Tewksbury: despair, therefore, and die!</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">Be cheerful, Richmond; for the wronged souls</div>
                              <div class="line">Of butcher'd princes fight in thy behalf</div>
                              <div class="line">King Henry's issue, Richmond, comforts thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghost of King Henry VI</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of King Henry VI</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">When I was mortal, my anointed body</div>
                              <div class="line">By thee was punched full of deadly holes</div>
                              <div class="line">Think on the Tower and me: despair, and die!</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry the Sixth bids thee despair, and die!</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">Virtuous and holy, be thou conqueror!</div>
                              <div class="line">Harry, that prophesied thou shouldst be king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth comfort thee in thy sleep: live, and flourish!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghost of CLARENCE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of CLARENCE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Let me sit heavy on thy soul to-morrow!</div>
                              <div class="line">I, that was wash'd to death with fulsome wine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Poor Clarence, by thy guile betrayed to death!</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow in the battle think on me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fall thy edgeless sword: despair, and die!--</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">Thou offspring of the house of Lancaster</div>
                              <div class="line">The wronged heirs of York do pray for thee</div>
                              <div class="line">Good angels guard thy battle! live, and flourish!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghosts of RIVERS, GRAY, and VAUGHAN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of RIVERS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Let me sit heavy on thy soul to-morrow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rivers. that died at Pomfret! despair, and die!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of GREY</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Think upon Grey, and let thy soul despair!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of VAUGHAN</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Think upon Vaughan, and, with guilty fear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let fall thy lance: despair, and die!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">All</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To RICHMOND</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Awake, and think our wrongs in Richard's bosom</div>
                              <div class="line">Will conquer him! awake, and win the day!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghost of HASTINGS</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of HASTINGS</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Bloody and guilty, guiltily awake,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in a bloody battle end thy days!</div>
                              <div class="line">Think on Lord Hastings: despair, and die!</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">Quiet untroubled soul, awake, awake!</div>
                              <div class="line">Arm, fight, and conquer, for fair England's sake!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghosts of the two young Princes</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghosts of young Princes</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Dream on thy cousins smother'd in the Tower:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us be led within thy bosom, Richard,</div>
                              <div class="line">And weigh thee down to ruin, shame, and death!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy nephews' souls bid thee despair and die!</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">Sleep, Richmond, sleep in peace, and wake in joy;</div>
                              <div class="line">Good angels guard thee from the boar's annoy!</div>
                              <div class="line">Live, and beget a happy race of kings!</div>
                              <div class="line">Edward's unhappy sons do bid thee flourish.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghost of LADY ANNE</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of LADY ANNE</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">Richard, thy wife, that wretched Anne thy wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">That never slept a quiet hour with thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now fills thy sleep with perturbations</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow in the battle think on me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fall thy edgeless sword: despair, and die!</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">Thou quiet soul, sleep thou a quiet sleep</div>
                              <div class="line">Dream of success and happy victory!</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy adversary's wife doth pray for thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the Ghost of BUCKINGHAM</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Ghost of BUCKINGHAM</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To KING RICHARD III</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">The last was I that helped thee to the crown;</div>
                              <div class="line">The last was I that felt thy tyranny:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, in the battle think on Buckingham,</div>
                              <div class="line">And die in terror of thy guiltiness!</div>
                              <div class="line">Dream on, dream on, of bloody deeds and death:</div>
                              <div class="line">Fainting, despair; despairing, yield thy breath!</div>
                              <p>To RICHMOND</p>
                              <div class="line">I died for hope ere I could lend thee aid:</div>
                              <div class="line">But cheer thy heart, and be thou not dismay'd:</div>
                              <div class="line">God and good angel fight on Richmond's side;</div>
                              <div class="line">And Richard falls in height of all his pride.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>The Ghosts vanish</p>
                        <p>KING RICHARD III starts out of his dream</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me another horse: bind up my wounds.</div>
                              <div class="line">Have mercy, Jesu!--Soft! I did but dream.</div>
                              <div class="line">O coward conscience, how dost thou afflict me!</div>
                              <div class="line">The lights burn blue. It is now dead midnight.</div>
                              <div class="line">Cold fearful drops stand on my trembling flesh.</div>
                              <div class="line">What do I fear?  myself?  there's none else by:</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard loves Richard; that is, I am I.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is there a murderer here?  No. Yes, I am:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then fly. What, from myself?   Great reason why:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest I revenge. What, myself upon myself?</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack. I love myself. Wherefore?  for any good</div>
                              <div class="line">That I myself have done unto myself?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, no! alas, I rather hate myself</div>
                              <div class="line">For hateful deeds committed by myself!</div>
                              <div class="line">I am a villain: yet I lie. I am not.</div>
                              <div class="line">Fool, of thyself speak well: fool, do not flatter.</div>
                              <div class="line">My conscience hath a thousand several tongues,</div>
                              <div class="line">And every tongue brings in a several tale,</div>
                              <div class="line">And every tale condemns me for a villain.</div>
                              <div class="line">Perjury, perjury, in the high'st degree</div>
                              <div class="line">Murder, stem murder, in the direst degree;</div>
                              <div class="line">All several sins, all used in each degree,</div>
                              <div class="line">Throng to the bar, crying all, Guilty! guilty!</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall despair. There is no creature loves me;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if I die, no soul shall pity me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, wherefore should they, since that I myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Find in myself no pity to myself?</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought the souls of all that I had murder'd</div>
                              <div class="line">Came to my tent; and every one did threat</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow's vengeance on the head of Richard.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter RATCLIFF</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">'Zounds! who is there?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Ratcliff, my lord; 'tis I. The early village-cock</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath twice done salutation to the morn;</div>
                              <div class="line">Your friends are up, and buckle on their armour.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">O Ratcliff, I have dream'd a fearful dream!</div>
                              <div class="line">What thinkest thou, will our friends prove all true?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">No doubt, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">O Ratcliff, I fear, I fear,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, good my lord, be not afraid of shadows.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">By the apostle Paul, shadows to-night</div>
                              <div class="line">Have struck more terror to the soul of Richard</div>
                              <div class="line">Than can the substance of ten thousand soldiers</div>
                              <div class="line">Armed in proof, and led by shallow Richmond.</div>
                              <div class="line">It is not yet near day. Come, go with me;</div>
                              <div class="line">Under our tents I'll play the eaves-dropper,</div>
                              <div class="line">To see if any mean to shrink from me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Enter the Lords to RICHMOND, sitting in his tent</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORDS</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, Richmond!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Cry mercy, lords and watchful gentlemen,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you have ta'en a tardy sluggard here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORDS</div>
                              <div class="line">How have you slept, my lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">The sweetest sleep, and fairest-boding dreams</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever enter'd in a drowsy head,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I since your departure had, my lords.</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought their souls, whose bodies Richard murder'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Came to my tent, and cried on victory:</div>
                              <div class="line">I promise you, my soul is very jocund</div>
                              <div class="line">In the remembrance of so fair a dream.</div>
                              <div class="line">How far into the morning is it, lords?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORDS</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the stroke of four.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then 'tis time to arm and give direction.</div>
                              <p>His oration to his soldiers</p>
                              <div class="line">More than I have said, loving countrymen,</div>
                              <div class="line">The leisure and enforcement of the time</div>
                              <div class="line">Forbids to dwell upon: yet remember this,</div>
                              <div class="line">God and our good cause fight upon our side;</div>
                              <div class="line">The prayers of holy saints and wronged souls,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like high-rear'd bulwarks, stand before our faces;</div>
                              <div class="line">Richard except, those whom we fight against</div>
                              <div class="line">Had rather have us win than him they follow:</div>
                              <div class="line">For what is he they follow?  truly, gentlemen,</div>
                              <div class="line">A bloody tyrant and a homicide;</div>
                              <div class="line">One raised in blood, and one in blood establish'd;</div>
                              <div class="line">One that made means to come by what he hath,</div>
                              <div class="line">And slaughter'd those that were the means to help him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Abase foul stone, made precious by the foil</div>
                              <div class="line">Of England's chair, where he is falsely set;</div>
                              <div class="line">One that hath ever been God's enemy:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, if you fight against God's enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">God will in justice ward you as his soldiers;</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do sweat to put a tyrant down,</div>
                              <div class="line">You sleep in peace, the tyrant being slain;</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do fight against your country's foes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your country's fat shall pay your pains the hire;</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do fight in safeguard of your wives,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your wives shall welcome home the conquerors;</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do free your children from the sword,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your children's children quit it in your age.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, in the name of God and all these rights,</div>
                              <div class="line">Advance your standards, draw your willing swords.</div>
                              <div class="line">For me, the ransom of my bold attempt</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall be this cold corpse on the earth's cold face;</div>
                              <div class="line">But if I thrive, the gain of my attempt</div>
                              <div class="line">The least of you shall share his part thereof.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound drums and trumpets boldly and cheerfully;</div>
                              <div class="line">God and Saint George! Richmond and victory!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Re-enter KING RICHARD, RATCLIFF, Attendants
and Forces</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">What said Northumberland as touching Richmond?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">That he was never trained up in arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">He said the truth: and what said Surrey then?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">He smiled and said 'The better for our purpose.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">He was in the right; and so indeed it is.</div>
                              <p>Clock striketh</p>
                              <div class="line">Ten the clock there. Give me a calendar.</div>
                              <div class="line">Who saw the sun to-day?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">Not I, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Then he disdains to shine; for by the book</div>
                              <div class="line">He should have braved the east an hour ago</div>
                              <div class="line">A black day will it be to somebody. Ratcliff!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RATCLIFF</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">The sun will not be seen to-day;</div>
                              <div class="line">The sky doth frown and lour upon our army.</div>
                              <div class="line">I would these dewy tears were from the ground.</div>
                              <div class="line">Not shine to-day! Why, what is that to me</div>
                              <div class="line">More than to Richmond?  for the selfsame heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">That frowns on me looks sadly upon him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter NORFOLK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">Arm, arm, my lord; the foe vaunts in the field.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, bustle, bustle; caparison my horse.</div>
                              <div class="line">Call up Lord Stanley, bid him bring his power:</div>
                              <div class="line">I will lead forth my soldiers to the plain,</div>
                              <div class="line">And thus my battle shall be ordered:</div>
                              <div class="line">My foreward shall be drawn out all in length,</div>
                              <div class="line">Consisting equally of horse and foot;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our archers shall be placed in the midst</div>
                              <div class="line">John Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Earl of Surrey,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall have the leading of this foot and horse.</div>
                              <div class="line">They thus directed, we will follow</div>
                              <div class="line">In the main battle, whose puissance on either side</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall be well winged with our chiefest horse.</div>
                              <div class="line">This, and Saint George to boot! What think'st thou, Norfolk?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">A good direction, warlike sovereign.</div>
                              <div class="line">This found I on my tent this morning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>He sheweth him a paper</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>
                              </div>
                              <div class="line">'Jockey of Norfolk, be not too bold,</div>
                              <div class="line">For Dickon thy master is bought and sold.'</div>
                              <div class="line">A thing devised by the enemy.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, gentleman, every man unto his charge</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not our babbling dreams affright our souls:</div>
                              <div class="line">Conscience is but a word that cowards use,</div>
                              <div class="line">Devised at first to keep the strong in awe:</div>
                              <div class="line">Our strong arms be our conscience, swords our law.</div>
                              <div class="line">March on, join bravely, let us to't pell-mell</div>
                              <div class="line">If not to heaven, then hand in hand to hell.</div>
                              <p>His oration to his Army</p>
                              <div class="line">What shall I say more than I have inferr'd?</div>
                              <div class="line">Remember whom you are to cope withal;</div>
                              <div class="line">A sort of vagabonds, rascals, and runaways,</div>
                              <div class="line">A scum of Bretons, and base lackey peasants,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom their o'er-cloyed country vomits forth</div>
                              <div class="line">To desperate ventures and assured destruction.</div>
                              <div class="line">You sleeping safe, they bring to you unrest;</div>
                              <div class="line">You having lands, and blest with beauteous wives,</div>
                              <div class="line">They would restrain the one, distain the other.</div>
                              <div class="line">And who doth lead them but a paltry fellow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Long kept in Bretagne at our mother's cost?</div>
                              <div class="line">A milk-sop, one that never in his life</div>
                              <div class="line">Felt so much cold as over shoes in snow?</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's whip these stragglers o'er the seas again;</div>
                              <div class="line">Lash hence these overweening rags of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">These famish'd beggars, weary of their lives;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, but for dreaming on this fond exploit,</div>
                              <div class="line">For want of means, poor rats, had hang'd themselves:</div>
                              <div class="line">If we be conquer'd, let men conquer us,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not these bastard Bretons; whom our fathers</div>
                              <div class="line">Have in their own land beaten, bobb'd, and thump'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">And in record, left them the heirs of shame.</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall these enjoy our lands?  lie with our wives?</div>
                              <div class="line">Ravish our daughters?</div>
                              <p>Drum afar off</p>
                              <div class="line">Hark! I hear their drum.</div>
                              <div class="line">Fight, gentlemen of England! fight, bold yoemen!</div>
                              <div class="line">Draw, archers, draw your arrows to the head!</div>
                              <div class="line">Spur your proud horses hard, and ride in blood;</div>
                              <div class="line">Amaze the welkin with your broken staves!</div>
                              <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                              <div class="line">What says Lord Stanley? will he bring his power?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, he doth deny to come.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Off with his son George's head!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NORFOLK</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, the enemy is past the marsh</div>
                              <div class="line">After the battle let George Stanley die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand hearts are great within my bosom:</div>
                              <div class="line">Advance our standards, set upon our foes</div>
                              <div class="line">Our ancient word of courage, fair Saint George,</div>
                              <div class="line">Inspire us with the spleen of fiery dragons!</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon them! victory sits on our helms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum: excursions. Enter NORFOLK and forces
fighting; to him CATESBY</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">Rescue, my Lord of Norfolk, rescue, rescue!</div>
                              <div class="line">The king enacts more wonders than a man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Daring an opposite to every danger:</div>
                              <div class="line">His horse is slain, and all on foot he fights,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seeking for Richmond in the throat of death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Rescue, fair lord, or else the day is lost!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Alarums. Enter KING RICHARD III</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CATESBY</div>
                              <div class="line">Withdraw, my lord; I'll help you to a horse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING RICHARD III</div>
                              <div class="line">Slave, I have set my life upon a cast,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will stand the hazard of the die:</div>
                              <div class="line">I think there be six Richmonds in the field;</div>
                              <div class="line">Five have I slain to-day instead of him.</div>
                              <div class="line">A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarum. Enter KING RICHARD III and RICHMOND; they
fight. KING RICHARD III is slain. Retreat and
flourish. Re-enter RICHMOND, DERBY bearing the
crown, with divers other Lords</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">God and your arms be praised, victorious friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">The day is ours, the bloody dog is dead.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">Courageous Richmond, well hast thou acquit thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, here, this long-usurped royalty</div>
                              <div class="line">From the dead temples of this bloody wretch</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I pluck'd off, to grace thy brows withal:</div>
                              <div class="line">Wear it, enjoy it, and make much of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Great God of heaven, say Amen to all!</div>
                              <div class="line">But, tell me, is young George Stanley living?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town;</div>
                              <div class="line">Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">What men of name are slain on either side?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DERBY</div>
                              <div class="line">John Duke of Norfolk, Walter Lord Ferrers,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Robert Brakenbury, and Sir William Brandon.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">RICHMOND</div>
                              <div class="line">Inter their bodies as becomes their births:</div>
                              <div class="line">Proclaim a pardon to the soldiers fled</div>
                              <div class="line">That in submission will return to us:</div>
                              <div class="line">And then, as we have ta'en the sacrament,</div>
                              <div class="line">We will unite the white rose and the red:</div>
                              <div class="line">Smile heaven upon this fair conjunction,</div>
                              <div class="line">That long have frown'd upon their enmity!</div>
                              <div class="line">What traitor hears me, and says not amen?</div>
                              <div class="line">England hath long been mad, and scarr'd herself;</div>
                              <div class="line">The brother blindly shed the brother's blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">The father rashly slaughter'd his own son,</div>
                              <div class="line">The son, compell'd, been butcher to the sire:</div>
                              <div class="line">All this divided York and Lancaster,</div>
                              <div class="line">Divided in their dire division,</div>
                              <div class="line">O, now, let Richmond and Elizabeth,</div>
                              <div class="line">The true succeeders of each royal house,</div>
                              <div class="line">By God's fair ordinance conjoin together!</div>
                              <div class="line">And let their heirs, God, if thy will be so.</div>
                              <div class="line">Enrich the time to come with smooth-faced peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!</div>
                              <div class="line">Abate the edge of traitors, gracious Lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">That would reduce these bloody days again,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make poor England weep in streams of blood!</div>
                              <div class="line">Let them not live to taste this land's increase</div>
                              <div class="line">That would with treason wound this fair land's peace!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now civil wounds are stopp'd, peace lives again:</div>
                              <div class="line">That she may long live here, God say amen!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
         </div>
      </article>

   </body>
</html>
The “current” CSS styling is applied to the this entire document; the results in this column may be anomalous. Also, image links are broken in this column. 

The Tragedy of Richard the Third

    • 1. SCENE I. London. A street.
    • 2. SCENE II. Before Lord Hastings' house.
    • 3. SCENE III. Pomfret Castle.

    • 1. SCENE I. Before the Tower.

    • 5. SCENE V. Lord Derby's house.
  • 5. ACT V
    • 1. SCENE I. Salisbury. An open place.
    • 2. SCENE II. The camp near Tamworth.
    • 3. SCENE III. Bosworth Field.
    • 4. SCENE IV. Another part of the field.
    • 5. SCENE V. Another part of the field.

Dramatis Personae

KING EDWARD The Fourth

EDWARD, Prince of Wales, afterwards King Edward V. RICHARD, Duke of York sons to the King.
GEORGE, Duke of Clarence RICHARD, Duke of Gloucester, afterwards King Richard III. brothers to the King.

A young son of Clarence.

HENRY, Earl of Richmond, afterwards King Henry VII.

CARDINAL BOURCHIER, Archbishop of Canterbury.

THOMAS ROTHERHAM, Archbishop of York.

JOHN MORTON, Bishop of Ely.

DUKE of BUCKINGHAM

DUKE of NORFOLK

EARL of SURREY, His son.

EARL RIVERS, Brother to Elizabeth.

MARQUIS OF DORSET LORD GREY Sons to Elizabeth.

EARL of OXFORD

LORD HASTINGS

LORD STANLEY, Called also EARL of DERBY.

LORD LOVEL

SIR THOMAS VAUGHAN

SIR RICHARD RATCLIFF

SIR WILLIAM CATESBY

SIR JAMES TYRREL

SIR JAMES BLOUNT

SIR WALTER HERBERT

SIR ROBERT BRAKENBURY, Lieutenant of the Tower.

CHRISTOPHER URSWICK, A priest.

Another Priest.

TRESSEL BERKELEY Gentlemen attending on the Lady Anne.

Lord Mayor of London.

Sheriff of Wiltshire.

ELIZABETH, Queen to King Edward IV.

MARGARET, Widow of King Henry VI.

DUCHESS of YORK, Mother to King Edward IV.

LADY ANNE, Widow of Edward Prince of Wales, son to King Henry VI; afterwards married to Richard.

A young Daughter of Clarence [MARGARET PLANTAGENET]

Ghosts of those murdered by Richard III., Lords and other Attendants; a Pursuivant Scrivener, Citizens, Murderers, Messengers Soldiers, &c.

SCENE England.

Chapter 1. ACT I

Table of Contents

  • 1. SCENE I. London. A street.
  • 2. SCENE II. The same. Another street.
  • 3. SCENE III. The palace.
  • 4. SCENE IV. London. The Tower.

1. SCENE I. London. A street.

Enter GLOUCESTER, solus

GLOUCESTER
Now is the winter of our discontent
Made glorious summer by this sun of York;
And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house
In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.
Now are our brows bound with victorious wreaths;
Our bruised arms hung up for monuments;
Our stern alarums changed to merry meetings,
Our dreadful marches to delightful measures.
Grim-visaged war hath smooth'd his wrinkled front;
And now, instead of mounting barded steeds
To fright the souls of fearful adversaries,
He capers nimbly in a lady's chamber
To the lascivious pleasing of a lute.
But I, that am not shaped for sportive tricks,
Nor made to court an amorous looking-glass;
I, that am rudely stamp'd, and want love's majesty
To strut before a wanton ambling nymph;
I, that am curtail'd of this fair proportion,
Cheated of feature by dissembling nature,
Deformed, unfinish'd, sent before my time
Into this breathing world, scarce half made up,
And that so lamely and unfashionable
That dogs bark at me as I halt by them;
Why, I, in this weak piping time of peace,
Have no delight to pass away the time,
Unless to spy my shadow in the sun
And descant on mine own deformity:
And therefore, since I cannot prove a lover,
To entertain these fair well-spoken days,
I am determined to prove a villain
And hate the idle pleasures of these days.
Plots have I laid, inductions dangerous,
By drunken prophecies, libels and dreams,
To set my brother Clarence and the king
In deadly hate the one against the other:
And if King Edward be as true and just
As I am subtle, false and treacherous,
This day should Clarence closely be mew'd up,
About a prophecy, which says that 'G'
Of Edward's heirs the murderer shall be.
Dive, thoughts, down to my soul: here
Clarence comes.

Enter CLARENCE, guarded, and BRAKENBURY

Brother, good day; what means this armed guard
That waits upon your grace?
CLARENCE
His majesty
Tendering my person's safety, hath appointed
This conduct to convey me to the Tower.
GLOUCESTER
Upon what cause?
CLARENCE
Because my name is George.
GLOUCESTER
Alack, my lord, that fault is none of yours;
